loans.name: Maria Irma Del Transito

texts.es:
María, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive con sus padres y hermanos.

María, se dedica a trabajar en una cooperativa vendiendo productos de granos básicos como maíz, frijol, y concentrados para bovinos y especies menores, desde hace dos años y medio está adquiriendo experiencia en ventas, ella trabaja a unos minutos de su casa, antes trabajaba en casa cuidando niños. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como semilla, fertilizantes, para preparar la parcela y para pagar mano de obra para que le ayuden con la siembra.

El sueño de María, es tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa y una tienda donde venda productos de la canasta básica, también sueña con construir su propia vivienda y asi darle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
28-year-old María went to school until the second year of high school. She is single and doesn't have children. She lives with her parents and siblings.

Maria makes a living by working in a cooperative, selling basic grain products, such as corn, beans, and feed for cattle and small animals. For the past 2 and a half years, she has been gaining sales experience. She works a few minutes away from her house; before, she worked in the home taking care of children.

María needs the loan to buy farming supplies like seed and fertilizers to prepare the plot, and to pay for labor to help with the sowing.

María's dream is to have her own business selling clothes, and a store where she can sell basic groceries. She also dreams of building her own house to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies like seed and fertilizers to prepare the plot, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es una mujer de 25 años de edad, es soltera con grandes propósitos en la vida, Irma cuenta que su vida ha sido beneficiada con el préstamo al que tuvo la oportunidad de acceder, pues a Dios gracias pudo comprar sus materiales para la elaboración de ropa típica y con ello sus ingresos han mejorado y ahora aspira a mucho más grande pues ahora su sueño es comprar un terreno donde pueda construir un local y vender mejor sus productos, pero su mayor dificultad es que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el terreno es por ello que nuevamente acude a un préstamo con ADICLA y KIVA porque ya conoce su forma de trabajar.
Su gran sueño es construir su local para poder superarse y darle una mejor vida  a su familia.
texts.en:
Irma is a 25-year old woman. She is single with great ambitions in life. She says that her life is better off because of the loan that she had the opportunity to access. Thankfully, she was able to buy her materials to make traditional clothing, and with this, her income has improved.

Now she aspires to something much bigger, and her dream now is buy a plot of land where she can build a store and better sell her products. Her greatest difficulty is that she doesn't have the necessary funds to buy the land. That is why she is applying again for a loan from ADICLA and Kiva, because they already know how she works.

Her greatest dream is to build her store so that she can get ahead and give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy land for future construction.

loans.name: Nestoria

texts.en:
Nestora's main source of living is by means of vegetable gardening. She toils the land and grows eggplant, pechay and tomatoes. It has been 20 years now that she engaged in vegetable farming. She is 58 years of age, married with 3 children ages 22, 19 and 12 year old respectively.

She would like to improve her gardening source of income by increasing the yield of her farm and able to sustain the family's daily needs. She has requested a loan to buy seedlings. With these, it could produce more and her income will slowly improve.

In the future, Nestora hopes that her existing livelihood will become successful and able to improve living condition of her family as well.

loans.use: to buy  seedlings

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is 48 years old, married with two children. Both of whom are in school.

Juvy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Juvy has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Juvy aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alegria Group

texts.es:
Ambar es una mujer de 28 años, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 3, 8 y 13 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, amigable y muy honesta. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘mutualista’ área central donde se encuentran las mayorías de las oficinas públicas y privadas.
Ambar es morena, de baja estatura y cabello negro, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (la primera de la derecha, viste polera rosa y pantalon negro). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en transporte, y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevó a formar una banca  de personas con negocios como; pintura de techos y paredes, taller de cerrajería, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de horneados tradicionales y librería. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos como; delineador de ojos, lápiz labial, maquillaje, correctores y otros, “recorro largas distancias buscando a mis clientes, ninguna visita es en vano siempre terminan llevándose algo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son a crédito y puede vender más, la desventaja es que recibe los pagos en cuotas y le resta capital para reinvertir en su negocio. Su sueño es abrir una tienda para dejar de ambular, ella desea comprar cosméticos por mayor para continuar vendiendo a crédito. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Ambar solicita un préstamo para comprar cosméticos por mayor y continuar con su negocio de ventas a crédito.
texts.en:
Ambar is a married, 28-year-old woman. She has 3 children, ages 3, 8, and 13. Her business is cosmetics sales.
She is a good mother, friendly, and very honest. She carries out her business in the "mutualista" central neighborhood where the majority of the public and private offices are found.
Ambar is tanned, short statured, and black haired. Her mother tongue is Guarani and she speaks Spanish. She is the first on the right, wearing a pink tank top and black capris. She shares her life with her husband who works in transportation, and with her children who study in school. They live in a rented brick house that has all the basic services. The need to improve her business brought her to form a bank of people with businesses such as: ceiling and wall painting; a locksmith; a food vendor; a second-hand clothes vendor; a natural health products vendor; a traditional baker; and a bookstore owner.
Her business is cosmetics sales such as: eyeliner, lipstick, foundation, concealer, and others. "I go over long distances searching for my clients. No one visits in vain, they always end up taking something," she comments. The advantage of her business is that the sales are on credit and she can sell more; the disadvantage is that she receives the payments in installments and it diminishes the capital to reinvest in her business. Her dream is to open a store in order to give up walking. She wants to buy wholesale cosmetics in order to continue selling on credit. This is her first loan sequence with this institution in her 2 years carrying out her business.
It is because of those motives that Ambar is requesting a loan to buy wholesale cosmetics and to continue with her business of selling on credit.

loans.use: to buy wholesale cosmetics and to continue with her business of selling on credit.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and married.

Teresita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Teresita has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Arsulita

texts.en:
Arsulita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Arsulita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with eight children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret operates a drug shop and a retail shop as her major source of income since the year 2007. She started a business with a purpose of sustaining her family with capital from maize harvests, she also supplements her family incomes with farming. Margret lives in Kagadi- Uganda; she’s 46 years old and has 4 children.

She needs money to increase her stock of sugar, soap and cooking oil. She has dreams of educating her children to higher levels and she is very hard working. Competition is her major challenge.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un gran hombre con grandes propósitos en la vida, él tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 9 y 17 años de edad, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá Sololá.
Miguel para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la venta de maxan desde hace 6 años, gracias a este negocio ha sacado adelante a su familia. Miguel con su amabilidad y respeto a logrado que mucha gente lo busque con sus productos, y con esta demanda Miguel ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para la compra de mas maxan para venderlos por bulto. Con esta inversión el espera satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes. Su esperanza de vida es construir una casa mucho más amplia para que su familia viva mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Miguel is a great man with big goals in life. He is 40 years old and single, and he has a lovely family of five children ranging in age from 9 to 17. This humble family lives in a community in Nahualá Sololá.

To obtain income, Miguel has been selling maxan leaves (used for wrapping tamales) for six years. Thanks to this business, he has been able to provide for his family. Because Miguel is friendly and respectful, many people seek him out for his products. Due to the demand, Miguel decided to request a loan to buy more maxan leaves to sell them in bulk. With this investment, he hopes to better meet the needs of his customers.

Miguel's hope in life is to build a much larger house so that his family can have a much better life.

loans.use: to buy and sell maxan leaves in bulk.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 40 años de edad, muy trabajadora y entusiasta por la vida, cuenta con una familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 15 y 21 años de edad, ellos viven en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Catarina para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la compra y venta de bananos, este negocio se ubica en el mercado regional de su comunidad y lo tiene ella desde hace 5 años. Catarina tiene una buena atención con sus clientes por lo que cuenta con mucha clientela y con el afán de satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los consumidos solicita un préstamo para invertirlo comprando más recinos de bananos como; cesa, chocolate, manzanita de oro entre las otras.
Su gran sueño es conseguir el crédito para mejorar sus ingresos y construir una casa más amplia para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Catarina is a 40 year old woman who is very hard-working and enthusiastic about life. She has a family of four children between the ages of 15 and 21 years old. They live in a community in Nahualá.

Catarina works buying and selling bananas in order to obtain her income and get her children ahead. Her business is located in the regional market of her community and she has been there for five years.

Catarina pays good attention to her customers so she has a large clientele. With the desire to better satisfy the needs of the consumers she is requesting a loan to buy more bananas varieties such as cesa, chocolate and manzanita de oro amongst others.

Her big dream is to get the loan to improve her income and build a bigger house so that her family can live better.

loans.use: to buy and sell bananas by the quintal.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La prestataria recibe tratamiento para una enfermedad compleja desde hace 18 meses. Tiene dos hijas, de 16 y 13 años, ambas afectadas por la misma condición. Su esposo falleció de la misma condición en 2012. Desde ese momento, la prestataria se encarga de mantener a su familia por su cuenta. 
Desde hace 18 años que la prestataria trabaja pintando artesanías para un taller. Dada su condición de salud y la de sus hijas, no va a trabajar al taller pero pinta las artesanías desde su casa. Eso ha afectado su producción y sus ingresos. Por este motivo, ha decidido buscar otro ingreso, pintando productos de temporada, por ejemplo, vasos y tazas con motivos navideños para vender en el mercado. 
La prestataria tiene una mesa en su casa que utiliza para pintar sus artesanías, hechas de yeso y cal, las cuales diseña con flores y termina con un laqueado para que tengan brillo antes de entregar al taller. Con el préstamo, la prestataria comprará artículos sin acabado ni diseño para trabajar ella misma los diseños. Además, comprará materiales tales como pinceles y pinturas.
texts.en:
This borrower has been receiving treatment for a complex illness for the past 18 months. She has two daughters, ages 16 and 13, both of whom are affected by the same condition. Her husband died of the same condition in 2012. Since that moment, the borrower has been maintaining her family on her own.

For the past 18 years, the borrower worked at a shop by painting handicrafts. Given the condition of her health and that of her daughters, she is not able to work at the shop. Instead, she paints handicrafts from her home. For this reason, the borrower has decided to find another source of income by painting seasonal products, such as drinking glasses and cups with Christmas themes, that she can sell at the market.

The borrower has a table at her house that she uses for painting her handicrafts, made from plaster and lime powder. Her works have floral designs and are finished with a coat of lacquer to give them a brilliant shine before being delivered to the shop. With this loan, the borrower will buy unfinished pieces on which can she can put her designs. She will also buy supplies, such as brushes and paints.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making handicrafts.

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en: Giorgi is 48 years old. He lives in Sagarejo district with his wife and daughter. Giorgi is unemployed and wishes to be involved in his own business so he requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,500 GEL. With the received credit, he will purchase meat to resell at a higher price. This will give him a chance to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family. Giorgi hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin selling meat.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is 35 years old and married. He has two children and takes care of his aging father. He has a small fattening project and sells milk. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 EGP to buy a head of cattle to expand his project.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is 30 years old, married, and has one son. He has a small grocery store project and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy grocery products such as rice, pasta, oil, and biscuits to expand his store.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as rice, pasta, oil, and biscuits.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Natasha School was founded in 1998 by Elizabeth and her husband. Both Elizabeth and her husband have experienced teaching backgrounds. Elizabeth decided to establish Natasha School in her community after many years of working as a teacher in several other schools. 'Natasha' is a Zambian word that, when translated, means ‘thank you.' The motivation to start Natasha School was their passion for making a difference in the lives of children through education. 

The mission statement of Natasha School is ‘Education is the key to success’ and their aim is to impart knowledge, good morals, discipline, and the ethic of hard work into the lives of children, so that they may grow up to be well-rounded individuals and positive contributors to their society.

Natasha School follows the Zambian Primary School Curriculum and would like to introduce the use of the ZEduPad tablets into the school to aid in the development of ICT skills in the children, while incorporating the school curriculum in all subjects to provide the best learning opportunities for the children. The ZEduPad is a revolutionary e-learning educational tablet designed for children and has pre-loaded content mapped to the Zambian Primary School curriculum.

loans.use: to purchase iSchool ZEduPads, revolutionary education tablets designed for use by primary school children that come pre-loaded with content mapped to the national school curriculum.

loans.name: Jean Exain

texts.fr: Exain, 37 ans, est bouquiniste. Il vit en union libre et à un enfant à charge. La vente de livre lui donne la possibilité de gagner de quoi faire vivre sa famille au jour le jour. Il rêve d’ouvrir une librairie à l’avenir. Il travaille sans relâche pour atteindre cet objectif.
texts.en: Exain, aged 37, is a book seller. He lives in a common-law marriage and has one child to support. Selling books allows him to earn something to support his family from day to day. His dream is to open a bookstore in the future. He is working tirelessly to attain this goal.

loans.use: to purchase school books for children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more spare car parts to sell.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is 37 years old from Tsalka district. She has a husband, a son, and a daughter, who works as a sales lady and gets 300 GEL per month. Dali receives income from selling her agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Her husband helps her greatly in her everyday activities related to farming. Dali cultivates a plot of land, where she harvests potatoes for local trading. She also breeds cattle and produces milk products. To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Dali and her husband need a method of transport to sell the products throughout the district and nearby villages.  

Dali has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Dali and her family, and she will improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus and start trading with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr: Richard, 35 ans, est marié et père de deux enfants. Il est tailleur et possède un atelier de couture. Il emploie deux autres personnes pour l’aider dans la l’exécution des commandes de ses clients. Il cherche ce prêt pour acheter des tissus.
texts.en: Richard, aged 35, is a married father of two. He is a tailor and owns a sewing workshop. He employs two other persons helping him in fulfilling orders from his customers. Richard is seeking a loan to purchase some fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase some fabrics

loans.name: Gomaa

texts.en:
Gomaa is 40 years old, married, and has two sons and one daughter. He also takes care of his aging mother. 

Gomaa has a small livestock project in which he raises goats and lambs and sells them after three months of fattening. He previously requested a 3000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. He is now requesting a 5000 EGP loan to buy more animals to increase his sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy more animals, such as goats and lambs.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.fr: Roseline est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas encore d’enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires dans une boutique au marché Chatuley de Léogane et a beaucoup de clients. Voulant éviter de potentielles ruptures de stock, elle a fait une demande de microcrédit pour mieux répondre aux exigences de ses clients. Elle veut agrandir son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie.
texts.en: Roseline is 30 years old. She is single and does not yet have children. She sells food in a shop at the Chatuley market in Léogane and has a lot of customers. Wanting to avoid potential stock shortages, she made a request for microcredit in order to better respond to the demands of her customers. She wants to expand her business and to offer herself better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy some bags of milled corn

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una señora con 56 años de edad, casada y con cuatro hijos ya mayores, actualmente uno de los hijos que le colabora económicamente quedo sin empleo, por esto se ve en la necesidad de generar ingresos por sus propios medios, desea tomar clases de repostería y de allí abrir su primer negocio.
Solicita el crédito con el fin de pagar el local y compra de insumos.
Sabe que con el apoyo de Interactuar y los prestamistas del portal Kiva podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad.
texts.en:
Elena is a 56 year old woman, married and has four adult children. At present one of her children who contributes to her economically has become unemployed so she sees the need to generate income on her own. She wants to take classes in confectionery and then open her first business.

She is requesting the loan to pay for her shop and buy supplies.

She knows that with the help of Interactuar and the lenders from Kiva she can make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to pay for a shop and buy supplies to start a confectionery business.

loans.name: Jesula

texts.fr: Jesula a 52 ans. Elle est mariée et a un enfant à charge. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Elle se débrouille quotidiennement dans l’espoir d’améliorer sa situation financière. Elle a besoin d’un pret pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Jesula is 52 years old. She is married and has a child to support. She sells food products. She gets by every day with the hope of improving her financial situation. She needs a loan in order to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy cases of powdered juice

loans.name: Osiana

texts.fr: Osiana a 34 ans. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfant. Elle revend des vêtements neufs pour homme, femme et enfant. L’activité marche très bien et se révèle très rentable. Elle veut en profiter davantage de cette opportunité. Elle ne rate jamais l’occasion d’ajouter de nouvelles marques de vêtements pour attirer de nouveaux clients et fidéliser ses anciens clients. A l’aide de microcrédits, elle développe son commerce progressivement.
texts.en: Osiana, aged 34, is unmarried and has no children. She sells new clothing for men, women and children. Her business is doing very well, and the profitability shows. Osiana wants to make even more of this opportunity. She never misses a chance to add new clothing brands to attract new customers and to win the loyalty of former customers. Through micro-loans, she is developing her business progressively.

loans.use: to purchase jeans, dresses, and shirts

loans.name: Qochasaywas Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QOCHASAYWAS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen Rosa ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de restaurant, negocio de venta de tejidos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de productos de belleza.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Qochasaywas” which is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Carmen Rosa is one of the members. She is 48 years old, single, and has four children. Carmen works at her restaurant business where she serves various dishes such as baked chicken, soups, and stir-fried meats. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M. Carmen has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to establish her restaurant. She is requesting a loan in order to buy ingredients for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

The other members engage in businesses such as managing a restaurant, selling woven articles, operating a grocery store, and selling beauty products.

Sra. Carmen Rosa appreciates those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking such as rice, vegetables, and chicken.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.fr: Lucina vit en union libre. Âgée de 42 ans, elle est mère de 5 enfants. Son compagnon est sans emploi. Elle, débrouillarde qu’elle est, a mis sur pied une petite entreprise de revente de produits alimentaires à son domicile. Elle gère ses revenus en très bonne gestionnaire, ses dépenses sont très bien ordonnées et contrôlées à la lettre. C’est ainsi qu’elle parvient à prendre soin de sa famille et faire un peu d’épargne pour l’avenir. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Lucina lives with a common-law partner. 42 years old, she is the mother of 5 children. Her partner is unemployed. She, resourceful as she is, set up a small food products resale business from her home. She manages her income as a very good manager. Her expenses are very well organized and controlled to the letter. In this way, she manages to take care of her family and to save a little for the future. She needs a microcredit to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy spices and cases of oil.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es estudiante del último año de la carrera de Derecho, actualmente está trabajando para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios de universidad.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser una profesional y de esa forma poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Liz is a student in the last year of the law program. She is now working in order to be able to cover the costs of her university studies.

She is a person who exerts herself in order to become a professional and in this way be able to help other people.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her program and thus continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for manufacturing griddles.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a rural housewife, 32 years old, hailing from Raychenga village in Falakata, West Bengal. She lives with her husband and two children (one daughter and one son), both of whom are students. Malati is very unfortunate in that she was deprived of any formal education in her childhood; she is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her husband runs a tea stall, which is the only income generating source for this family of four.

In order to cover the expenses of his family, Malati's husband opened a tea stall in the village two years ago. Every morning and evening, most of the customers flock in to have breakfast or to refresh themselves after a tiring and hectic day. Besides tea, he also sells biscuits, chips, and tiffin cakes. Now Malati wishes to expand the tea selling business to earn more. So she is availing a loan from Kiva via Belghoria Janakalyan Samity (BJS) so that her husband can purchase necessary ingredients for his tea stall and other food items to accommodate more customers.

Malati is hoping to earn more and provide the best education to her children and expand their business for a secured future.

Malati thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her husband's modest tea stall.

loans.name: Myrian

texts.es:
Myrian está cursando el 2do año de la carrera de Administración de Empresas, tiene 20 años, vive con sus padres, desea terminar sus estudios, para poder ser alguien en la vida y también poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Ella se está esforzando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder conseguirlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Myrian is in the second year of the program in business administration. She is 20 years old and lives with her parents. She wants to finish her studies in order to be able to be someone in life and also to be able to help her loved ones.

She is making an effort to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones. It is for this reason that she puts her best effort into being able to achieve it.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay the fees for her program and in this way be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Araceli

texts.es:
Araceli es de la ciudad de Caacupé, estudia para poder ser un gran profesional, y busca su desarrollo, es una persona que cada mañana se dedica a vender comidas rápidas, y también estudia la carrera de técnico en enfermería.
Ella es una persona que se sacrifica que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y sus derechos de examen, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Araceli is from the city of Caacupé. She is studying to be a great professional and seeks personal development. She is a person who works every morning selling fast food and also studies to become a nursing technician.

She is a person who sacrifices and strives to make something out of her life. She has requested this loan to pay her university fees and the cost of exams to be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay university fees and exam costs

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está estudiando la carrera de psicología, y comenta que su meta es terminar su carrera, trabajar en consultorio público.
Aspira a un cargo público, donde pueda desempeñarse como profesional y brindando así su ayuda a las personas. Le gustaría ayudar a su familia ya que ellos son su apoyo.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Modesta is from the city of San Ignacio. She is studying in the psychology program, and she comments that her goal is to finish her program and work in a public clinic.

She aspires to a public position where she can work as a professional, thus offering her help to people. She would like to help her family, since they are her support.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to pay the fees for her program and in this way be able to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 50 лет, не замужем, есть 21 летний сын. У Бактыгул- среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 25 овец. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 50 years old, not married, and has a 21-year-old son. Baktygul has a secondary-level education, and she practices field and animal husbandry as a source of income for her family. She began doing this 20 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Baktygul's very hard work, her farm now has 4 cows and 25 sheep. On 1.0 hectare of land, she grows corn. Her monthly income is 22,000 som (KGS).

In order to develop her farm, Baktygul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase her headcount of livestock. Baktygul plans to use the proceeds from her loan to continue increasing her number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy some cows to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Pinki

texts.en:
25-year-old Pinki is an enterprising woman. She lives in a small village in Kandi, West Bengal, with her husband and two children (a son and a daughter). Her son is studying in grade 3 and her daughter is in grade 1. Her husband is engaged in farming.

Being a housewife, only the strong determination of Pinki led her to overcome social barriers, and she managed to convince her family to run an animal husbandry business to provide a better life to her family members. Pinki rears dairy cows and sells milk in her neighborhood. Out of her family’s small income, Pinki is hardly maintaining her family. For additional income, Pinki wants to purchase more dairy cows to sell more milk in her locality as there is a great demand for milk. Thus, she has asked for a loan from Kiva's partner Belghoria Janakalyan Samity. With her efforts, she hopes she might increase the family income for her family’s well-being and secure the family's future.

Pinki conveys her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk selling business.

loans.name: Aziza

texts.ru: Азиза, 43 года, замужем, мать 3 дочерей и 2 сыновей. У Азизы- высшее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав более 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Азизы, в хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы. На 1,37 Га собственной земли она выращивает кукурузу, пшеницу и чеснок для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS) . В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Азиза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличение поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Азиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Aziza is 43 years old, married, and the mother of 3 daughters and 2 sons. Aziza has a post-secondary education, and she practices field and animal husbandry as a source of income for her family. She began doing this 15 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Aziza's very hard work, her farm now has 4 cows. On 1.37 hectares of her own land, she grows corn, wheat, and garlic for resale. Her monthly income is around 19,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her farm, Aziza has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase her headcount of livestock. Aziza plans to use the proceeds from her loan to continue developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cows in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima, age 46, is a married woman, who lives with her family in Baradoba village in Falakata of West Bengal. She is the mother of two daughters and one son. Anima is illiterate but can sign her name; she is a housewife who was deprived of formal education in her young age. Her daughters are married and her son is unemployed.

Anima's husband is involved in paddy cultivation. He has ten years of experience in this field. This is the main source of income for the family. He sells the products to his clients. His opinion is that it is very difficult to maintain his family with this small income. After that, to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible.

So, Anita wants to avail a loan to strengthen her husband's business. She is seeking a loan from Belghoria Janakalyan Samity, a Kiva partner. Since paddies grow well in a hot and wet climate, their region is suitable for paddy cultivation. They want to grab the opportunity to cultivate paddy on a large scale.

Anima will use this loan to purchase seeds and other inputs like fertilizers and manure, which will help her in this paddy cultivation business so that she will get higher productivity. This will help Anima to improve her quality of life and that of her family, providing the opportunity to get ahead. She is thankful to her lenders.

loans.use: To pay for agricultural inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario, de 60 años de edad, no estudio debido al conflicto armado que en ese momento sufrió el país, se casó hace 21 años y con su esposa ha procreado dos hijos que estudian en la escuela de la comunidad y tienen que viajar todos los días de lunes a viernes para llegar a las clases y se regresan por la tarde algunas veces a pie y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar.

Nazario, se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas específicamente siembra maíz, frijoles y sorgo para la familia y además otra parte de las cosechas las vende en la ciudad cuando alcanza buenos resultados, pero además de eso se dedica a trabajar como jornalero; tiene una picadora de sacate que en las temporadas también utiliza para obtener ingresos para la familia.- Aprendió todo lo que sabe gracias a sus padres; antes tenía que alquilar pero gracias a su esfuerzo y a la motivación de un amigo, ha logrado comprar un pequeño lote de tierra donde construyo su casa.

Nazario, solicita el crédito para comprar abono, pagar el alquiler de la tierra para sus cultivos y para la compra de una vaca, pues tiene 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 de metros cuadrados de frijoles en la comunidad. 

Nazario, sueña con seguir trabajando para darle el estudio a sus hijos y que ellos logren culminar una carrera universitaria.- Además quiere comprar más vacas lecheras para trabajar con ganado y obtener otros ingresos que le permitan un mejor desarrollo familiar.
texts.en:
Nazario, who is 60 years old, didn't go to school because of the armed conflict that the country was suffering at that time. He married 21 years ago, and he and his wife have two children who go to the school in the community. They have to travel every day from Monday to Friday to arrive at their classes, and they return in the afternoon, sometimes on foot. His wife does the household tasks.

Nazario does agricultural work. Specifically, he plants corn, beans, and sorghum for the family, and in addition, when he has good results, he sells another part of his harvests in the city. But in addition to this he works as a day laborer. He has a machine that grinds fodder for livestock, which he also uses in season to obtain income for the family. He learned everything that he knows thanks to his parents. In the past he had to rent, but thanks to his effort and to the motivation of a friend, he has managed to buy a little lot where he built his house.

Nazario is applying for the loan to buy compost, pay the rent for the land for his crops, and buy a cow, since he has 7000 square meters of corn and 7000 square meters of beans in the community.

Nazario dreams of continuing to work in order to give his children an education and have them complete a university program. In addition, he wants to buy more milk cows in order to work with livestock and obtain other income that will allow better development of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, pay the rent on the land for his crops, and buy a cow.

loans.name: Sharbat

texts.en:
Sharbat is forty, married and has five children. Her husband works in a restaurant, and she has a small grocery store.

Sharbat previously took out a 5,000 EGP loan through Kiva's field partner TADE and successfully repaid it on time. She has now applied for a 10,000 EGP loan to buy some groceries such as oil, pasta and rice to expand her inventory and generate more income for her children.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Lilian Francisca

texts.es:
Lilian, de 32 años de edad, es una persona trabajadora, solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado, creció con su padre, porque su mamá falleció cuando ella era muy pequeña de edad, ella junto a su padre se dedicaban al comercio; actualmente es madre de un niño y una niña de 14 años de edad, ella está casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Lilian, se dedica a la cosmetología, ella aprendió este oficio durante un curso que recibió en una academia, el cual era gratuito por parte de la alcaldía del municipio de donde vive, pero además de eso también se dedica a la venta de ropa, en esta actividad tiene más experiencia porque es la que realizaba con su padre desde muy pequeña.

Lilian, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para su negocio, ella quiere surtir más su negocio porque es muy rentable, ella pretende colocar un puesto fijo y salir a vender a otros pueblos aledaños. 

Ella sueña con tener un negocio más estable y brindarle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, para que puedan tener un empleo digno.
texts.en:
Lilian, who is 32 years old, is a hard-working person. She was only able to go to school through ninth grade. She grew up with her father, because her mother died when she was very young. She and her father worked in commerce. Now she is the mother of a son and a daughter age 14. She is married and her husband works in masonry.

Lilian works in cosmetology. She learned this trade during a course that she took at an academy, which was free through the city office of the town where she lives. But in addition to this she also works selling clothes. She has more experience in this business because it is what she did with her father from the time when she was very little.

Lilian needs the loan to purchase clothing for her business. She wants to stock her business more because it is very profitable. She plans to set up a fixed stall and go out to sell in neighboring towns.

She dreams of having a more stable business and offering the necessary education to her children so that they can have dignified employment.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is thirty years old, married and has one child. He has a small grocery store and is applying for a 5000 EGP loan through Kiva's field partner TADE. His loan will be used to buy inventory for his store such as oil, rice and pasta to increase his sales and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his store such as oil, rice and pasta

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cowpea seeds, Irish potatoes, and coffee for planting and to pay workers to do the work.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret is a hardworking, 36-year-old married woman living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop selling general merchandise and is very ambitious with high hopes of growing her business in the future to add to her personal income. Margret also sells chapatis and has managed to look after her family using the proceeds. Margret is grateful for the funds that helped her to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell during the festive season. She requests a loan to buy sanitary towels, jelly, and other shop items for selling.

loans.use: to buy sanitary towels, jelly, and other shop items for selling.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes used the previous loan to add more items to sell, such as soap and cooking oil. She owns a retail shop, which she operates twelve hours a day and seven days a week. She started this, with a hope of earning extra income for her family. She also earns a salary from the local government, which enables her to pay school fees for her children and repay the loan.

She faces the hardship of competition that leaves her with fewer customers than she would like. However, she hopes to expand her business into new areas in future, in order to generate more income and improve the standard of living for her family. Agnes has asked for another loan. She will use it to buy more items to sell, including salt, cooking oil, and rice, among others.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, including salt, cooking oil, and rice, among others.

loans.name: Zulma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Zulma, de 40 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, está acompañada y vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos.

Zulma, junto a su esposo se dedican a cultivar hortalizas como pepino, chile verde y tomates y es de estos cultivos de donde obtienen ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de sus hijos en el estudio.

El crédito lo necesita para cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de pepino, porque ya tiene el suelo preparado.

Zulma, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Zulma, 40 years old, is a very hard working and responsible person. She is accompanied by her husband and three children.

Along with her husband, Zulma works cultivating vegetables such as cucumbers, green chiles, and tomatoes. It is from these crops that they earn income to cover costs related to their children's education.

The loan is needed to plant 7,000 square meters of cucumbers, because she already has the soil prepared to plant.

Zulma dreams of seeing her children graduate with a college degree.

loans.use: to plant 7,000 square meters of cucumber.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a hardworking lady living in Fort Portal, Uganda. With the loan she obtained, she managed to use it for buying more sugar, cooking oil, and maize flour to sell. She is a farmer growing bananas on a large scale and also owns a retail shop that earns her more income. She is performing very well in her businesses and she thanks Kiva and Kiva lenders for supporting her to develop herself. With the profits, she has been able to repay the loan, cover the medical bills of her family, and pay workers working in the coffee and banana plantations. She is faced with the challenge of customers delaying to pay her, and this reduces her overall profits. However, Anna hopes to educate all her children and expand her business to new areas. Anna has asked for a loan to buy coffee seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy coffee seeds for planting.

loans.name: Melkis Humberto

texts.es:
Melkis, de 27 años de edad, creció solo con su mamá, porque su padre los abandonó debido a la situación económica, solo pudo estudiar hasta octavo grado, hoy en día se dedica a cultivar granos básicos y de ahí de donde obtiene ganancias y gracias a las enseñanzas de su tío aprendió el oficio de la albañilería.

Melkis, desde que tenía 15 años de edad se dedica a trabajar la agricultura, ya que es quien trabaja para los gastos de él y los de su mamá. 

El dinero del crédito lo necesita para sembrar de granos básicos, porque tiene 14,000 metros cuadrado de maíz para cultivar y no le alcanzo el dinero para terminar de cultivar.  

Melkis, planea con seguir trabajando la agricultura y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Melkis, who is 27 years old, grew up alone with his mother, because his father abandoned them. Due to the economic situation, he could only study until the 8th grade. Today his occupation is farming staple grains, and that is where he obtains a profit. Thanks to the teaching of his uncle he also learned the trade of construction work.
Melkis has worked in agriculture since he was 15 years old, as he is the one who works for his and his mother's expenses.
He needs the loan money to sow staple grains, because he has 14,000 square meters to farm, and he did not have enough money to finish farming.
Melkis plans to keep working in agriculture and to start a family.

loans.use: to sow staple grains, because he has 14,000 square meters of corn to farm.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a very hard-working man. He works seven days a week. He operates a retail shop, selling mostly general merchandise like sugar, salt, and cooking oil, among other items. In addition, he carries out farming, mainly growing cassava and beans, for extra income. He desires to grow and expand his business more, and to pay school fees for his children. On the other hand, stiff competition and high rents affect the realization of his desires. He is seeking a loan to buy more stock items to sell, like salt, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy more stock items to sell, like salt, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jazira

texts.en:
Jazira is married and works 12 hours a day. In addition, she is charged with the responsibility of taking care of four children. All of the children attend school in Hoima, Uganda.

Jazira ventured into operation of a salon, primarily plaiting hair for ladies, and selling braids and lotions, among other items. In order to supplement her income, she carries out farming, growing mainly cassava and beans.

She desires to grow and expand her business more, so as to educate her children. Jazira is faced with a challenge: she has few customers during ordinary days, and she struggles to serve a vast number of customers during festive seasons. She is requesting a loan to buy more machines for shaving hair. With these machines she will be able to meet the demands of her customers who request men's salon services.

loans.use: to buy more machines for shaving hair.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en: Aidah, a 28-year-old woman, is a cosmetics trader. She lives in Kagadi, Uganda, with her two children. Her love for cosmetics led her to start up her business, after she had finished her studies. Her start-up capital was earned from a tree nursery bed, which she still owns. Operating on a busy street has resulted in her business growing very fast. She hopes for an even brighter future, with funding from Kiva through HOFOKAM. Her dream is to buy land and build, in the future. She wants a loan to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sunday Tadeo

texts.en: Sunday Tadeo is a 44-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a business of growing bananas on a large scale, which he started in 2010 with a vision of earning daily income to look after his family. Alongside that, he earns a salary that contributes a lot to his overall income for the family. He is facing the challenge of weather changes that destroy the banana crops and render a low output. However, he is looking at diversifying his income to involve dairy farming. He has asked for a loan to mulch, prune, and pay labor costs for those who are working on the banana plantation.

loans.use: to mulch, prune, and pay labor costs for those who are working on the banana plantation.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es:
Milagro, de 38 años de edad, toda su vida se ha dedicado a los oficios domésticos, ya que sus padres no le dieron la oportunidad de estudiar, luego se casó y junto a su esposo procrearon dos hijos, de los cual su primer hijo tiene 19 años de edad y su segundo hijo tiene 13 años de edad.

Milagro, tiene tres años de administrar su tiendita y en ocasiones sale de su casa a vender verduras y de esa manera ella puede tener sus ingresos para contribuir a los gastos de su hogar.

El Crédito lo necesita para comprar mercadería para surtir más su tienda, porque tuvo que  invertir  en una  operación de su hijo, la cual fue muy costosa y es por eso que necesita de la ayuda del crédito para poder surtir su tienda nuevamente. 

Milagro, pretende ayudar a sus hijos para que terminen sus estudios y sean personas de bien en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Milagro, who is 38 years old, has done domestic work all her life, because her parents did not give her the opportunity to study. Later she married and together with her husband they had two children, the first one is 19 years old and the second one is 13 years old.
Milagro has been running her small shop for three years. On occasion she will leave her home to sell vegetables, and in this way she can have an income to contribute to the household expenses.
She needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, because she had to invest in an operation for her son, which was very expensive, and this is why she needs the help of the loan to be able to stock her store again.
Milgaro hopes to help her children so that they can finish their studies and be good people in society.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 35-year-old widow and mother of two children. She owns a pharmacy shop in Kagadi, Uganda. Annet lost her husband recently, and from him she inherited rental houses from which she got capital to start up the pharmacy business. She is a qualified nurse who opted for self-employment rather than being employed by someone. The daunting prospect of raising her children single-handed led her to start this business. Her only dream now is to see her children through school. She intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell at the pharmacy shop.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell at the pharmacy shop.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan has been in business for 10 years. He is originally from Ecuador and is the proud owner of a taxi business in the Newark area that helps people in his community get where they need to go. Over the last several years, Ivan has built a strong client base with many loyal customers who call him personally to request rides to the nearby hospital, airport, schools, and train station. 

Before he started his business, Ivan worked at a gas station where he saved all his money to purchase his vehicle. After many years of experience running his taxi business, he was able to pay for necessary registration to become an official taxi driver and insurance. He was able to quickly get set up with a local agency that helped him develop his initial clients.

His greatest success in running his business has been the ability to attract repeat clients who prefer his local, personalized service. His largest difficulty is competition from new taxi companies that are growing from New York into the New Jersey area. Ivan is currently seeking a loan to pay for membership fees with a new agency that will help his business stay competitive. His customer base keeps his business running steadily and this loan will help him improve his business. 

Ivan is married and has two young children. Ivan's wife doesn't work, and Ivan is the primary source of income for his family. A Kiva loan from you will help Ivan's local business continue serving the Newark community.

loans.use: to pay for new insurance and membership fees.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a woman in her early 30s. She is married but her husband currently lives in the States. With him, she has three young kids who she takes care of on her own. She practically raises them, although her husband sends remittances. Sometimes the money that her husband sends is not enough, so nine years ago, give or take, she decided to start a small grocery store in order to create constant income for her house.

She has taken a loan from Kubo and Kiva and she felt pretty comfortable with it, so now she is looking for a new loan for 30,000 MXN, which will allow her to increase her stock and buy some fixed assets like refrigerators and showcases.

loans.use: to restock her grocery store.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.en:
Fidelia is 21 years old. She lives at her parents' house. She is the mother of one son. She is a baker and she needs another loan to buy supplies such as sugar, flour and cheese. Fidelia told us she is doing well but she would like to buy more ingredients to increase her production. Fidelia knows how to do a lot of pastries and she hopes you can trust her again.

In the picture, you can see her with some of the pastries she cooks and she is ready to sell.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sugar, flour, and cheese.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is a single woman. She lives with her father and she helps him.  Luz is a seamstress and she works at her sister's workshop. Luz needs a loan to buy a sewing machine. She hopes you can help her. She likes to work with her sister but she thinks it is time for her to open her own workshop and to make clothes for children only.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is 21 years old and single. He lives with his parents but he sells sunglasses. He is an itinerant seller who goes to many fairs. Angel needs a loan to buy a stand to display the sunglasses he sells.

Angel helps his mother with the expenses and he hopes you can help him because he needs to put his merchandise in a very safe place. So the stand will be very useful for him.

In the picture, Angel is working at one of the fairs he attends.

loans.use: to buy a stand to display the sunglasses he sells.

loans.name: Brote De Olivo Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Brote de Olivo” is located in San Pedro Yepocapa, Chimaltenango, Guatemala. It is a group of eight women who are involved in various commercial ventures including the sale of clothing, bedspreads, straw floor mats, and catalogue clothing sales.

This is the group’s third loan with Friendship Bridge and their first with Kiva.

Silvia is the 33-year-old secretary of the Trust Bank. She is married and was able to attend elementary school. Two of her three children are in school in the second and fourth grades. Her youngest child is three years of age.

Silvia has both a clothing as well as a coffee business. She buys and sells new clothing for the local market as well as coffee. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing like underwear and pants. Silvia would also like to buy a small motorcycle so that she can transport her merchandise in an easier way.

The vision of Friendship Bridge is a world in which empowered women eliminate poverty. In funding loans for these women, Kiva lenders play an important role. They will be better equipped to create a better future for themselves, their children and their communities through microfinance and education. Thank you, Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to purchase more clothing like underwear and pants to sell

loans.name: Eucalipto Group

texts.en:
Huehuetenango is in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is extremely mountainous, with steep slopes and deep ravines. Many types of trees grow there, among them the eucalyptus, which has inspired the name of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group 'Eucalipto'. The eight women range in age from 19 to 49 years, and have elementary and high school educations. They all are mothers with between four and six children each. These hardworking women have small businesses such as convenience stores, tortilla shops, fast food shops, and a cosmetic catalogue business. This is their second loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and their first with Kiva.

The enterprising Elvia, who is 34 years old with six children and a sixth-grade education, is asking for a loan in order to open a second convenience store, as well as a tortilla shop. She wants to buy sugar, beans, salt, noodles for the convenience shop and corn along with wood for the tortilla shop. Elvia wants to increase the income from her shops in order to make certain her children will all have a good education and a prosperous future. 

Kiva investors are an important part of the process of microloans and education that Friendship Bridge calls 'Microcredit Plus'. It is a program combining the loans from Kiva and non-formal education from Friendship Bridge presented at the monthly meetings of Eucalipto by a facilitator from the organization, who engages the group with drawings about topics, pictures and role-playing. These educational topics range from health and hygiene to important business management tools. All the women develop a strong self-esteem, which leads to them being empowered and successful entrepreneurial women.  

Thank you Kiva investors for helping them to improve the quality of their lives and those of their children!

loans.use: to open a second convenience store.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a twenty-two-year-old woman a with one-year-old dependent. Her partner is a fisherman. She earns a living by selling fresh fish to the locals in her place. She resides in the town of Loon, Bohol.

She has been selling fish for quite some time. She would like to improve her livelihood by acquiring additional funds to support her livelihood.

She decided to take a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing net, weights, floater and ice box (fish storage). These tools will help improve the ongoing catch of her partner. It could boost her daily income and ability to sell more fish. Thus, she could continue to provide for the needs of her growing child and also continue to expand her source of income to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, weights, floater and ice box (fish storage)

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a 44-year old married woman with four dependents. She engages in dried-fish vending kind of livelihood. She also runs a furniture shop. She caters to orders like dining table, chairs, and house decorations.

Her oldest child is 11 while the youngest is 3. She has been engaged in that kind of business for 12 years now.

She has requested a loan to buy materials like wood, varnish, nails, and to purchase more dried fish. This will enable Hilda to improve both of her sources of income. She would be able to pay for her obligation and handle her finances afterwards. 

Hilda is hoping that these resources will improve, coupled with determination and hard work to become successful.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, varnish, nails, and to purchase more dried fish

loans.name: Jay Ellaine

texts.en:
Jay Ellaine is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jay Ellaine has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Jay Ellaine has requested a 6,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Jay Ellaine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is an experienced dairy farmer. He lives by selling his cows' milk and cultivating a corn field on a plot of land close to his field.

By investing in a waste-to-energy biodigester, he will become his own supplier of energy and fertilizer, improving his economy and protecting the environment as a result. Indeed, he will not only displace petroleum-based external inputs, but also displace the wood he used to buy for cooking purposes, and reduce his farm's carbon footprint by reducing emissions of greenhouse gases from raw manure. His farm will become a cleaner, more sustainable and comfortable place to work and live for his family. His wife will no longer inhale the toxic smoke of burning wood while she cooks, as it will be replaced by the beautiful blue biogas flame. In addition, the yield of Jaime's corn field will improve with the nutrient-rich biofertilizer produced by the bacteria in the biodigester.

As he starts saving money, Jaime plans to expand his dairy activities to the production of cheese, and buy additional cows.

This loan represents 50% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to acquire a 20 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Celsa is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Celsa has a buy and sell fruits business in the Philippines. Celsa requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her business.

Celsa has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Celsa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her business

loans.name: José Felipe

texts.en:
José Felipe is a small dairy farmer and makes a living by selling the milk his cows produce on a weekly basis. 

He decided to invest in a biodigester in order to transform the once useless manure of his cows and sheep into productive, money-saving resources: biogas and organic fertilizer. By putting the waste in the biodigester, bacteria and the natural methanisation process will indeed produce renewable energy to cook and heat water, as well as nutrient-rich biofertilizer to increase the yield of his corn field in a sustainable manner. José Felipe will then be able to progressively displace fossil fuels and chemical fertilizers, which used to represent the largest portion of his operating expenses. 

As he starts saving money, José Felipe would like to diversify his activities and enter into cheese production. Furthermore, he plans to improve the cows' corrals. 

This loan represents 50% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a down payment made by the client.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is an ambitious young farmer who is always looking out for innovations and opportunities to improve his family's living conditions. He is pictured here with one of his two children. Marcos decided to purchase a biodigester in an ongoing effort to turn his farm into a cost-effective and sustainable place to live and work. 

By transforming his cows' manure into biogas and organic fertilizer, Marcos will displace the fossil fuel-based LP gas, chemical fertilizers and the wood his wife and children used to collect in the surrounding areas. Manure piling up and toxic smoke from burning wood will belong to the past, while Marcos' economy will improve and the yield of his corn field will increase as he applies the biofertilizer.

Besides his calves-selling activity, Marcos plans to use his savings to turn his farm into an ecotouristic place, where he can lodge visitors and show his sustainable farming activities to more people. 

This loan represents 50% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a down payment made by the client.

loans.use: to invest in a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Melqui

texts.en:
Melqui is 42 years old. She's married and has three children to provide for. She is 42 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

Melqui plants coconut trees and vegetables to grow fruit and vegetables to sell. She has been selling crops for over three years and has made favorable returns. Her spouse works as a rice mill operator but his work is not permanent in nature. Melqui joined and gained access to GDMPC.

She requests a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and to cover the costs of plowing the farm to enhance the growth of crops and ensure a high potential of return on investment.

In the future, Melqui hopes to expand the cultivated area and raise more of these plants to gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to cover the costs of plowing the farm

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 49 years old and has three children. She is a married woman.

Zosima is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Zosima would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 48 years old and has six children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Lolita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lolita has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Maria Nerie

texts.en:
Maria Nerie is a 52-year-old married woman with four children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Maria Nerie has a buy-and-sell spice business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of spices to sell in her business. She has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Maria Nerie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell in her business.

loans.name: Guadencia

texts.en:
Guadencia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Guadencia is 54 years old and four of her children are in school.

Guadencia has a buy and sell of fruits business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

Guadencia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Guadencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

Tessie has been in this business for five years. Tessie earns more income from her general store.

Tessie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, flour, and cooking oil for her food production business.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 52 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mary Ann has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Relania

texts.en:
Relania is a resident in the town of Loon, Bohol. Her husband is a driver. They were blessed with three children. Her oldest child is 10 while the youngest is 3.

She earns a living by selling frozen goods like dressed chicken, hot dogs, ham, sausage and lumpia (spring rolls).

She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks such as ham, longanisa (sausage) and lumpia (spring roll). These are vital to her day-to-day livelihood activity. It would enable her to purchase in bulk quantity, enabling her to augment her earnings and continue to provide her family with healthy meals.

In the future, Relania would like to improve her source of income to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to purchase such as ham, longanisa (sausage) and lumpia (spring roll).

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is 59 years old and has one child. She is a married woman.

Martina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Martina has been in this business for 22 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Martina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Hoeurn Group

texts.en:
Hoeurn is 46 years old and a married mother with three children who lives in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has two children who attend school and another one who works as a factory worker.

She has been involved in animal husbandry and cultivating rice since 1989. Her husband is a 39-year-old rice farmer as well. Together, they can earn approximately USD 3.5 per day. Hoeurn is a group leader, and would like to request a loan for the five members. She will use her portion to buy pig feed and improve her family’s finances by selling those pigs.

Hoeurn is pictured first from the right. In the future, she is going to buy more pigs and cows, and help her children to earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 26-year-old woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Christine has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Christine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 42 years old and married with two children.

Maribeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Maribeth has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Maribeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lisa is 34 years old and all of her children are in school.

Lisa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Lisa has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Lisa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is a 45-year-old married woman with eight children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marita has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Marita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Chính

texts.en:
Chính is 55 years old and married. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village.

She has been working in agriculture for 8 years, raising poultry. However, the market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to do to be comfortable in life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

In 2012, Chính joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 3 loans from them.

In the future, Chính hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be happy and healthy.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Melba works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming rice. Melba is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional firewood to sell to her customers.

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên is 32 years old and married. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village.

Liên has been working in agriculture, raising poultry, for 5 years. However, the market need is low in this region, and the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to do to be comfortable in life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true.

In the future, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.
