Faustina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like coffee, detergent soap, milk, juice, eggs, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

Faustina has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, milk, juice, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Faustina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like coffee, detergent soap, milk, juice, eggs, soft drinks, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Nary, 32, is living in a rural village of Battambang province. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are in school, while the others are underage for school.

The main source of her family’s income has been from growing cassava for six years. She can earn supplemental income via working for a labor fee.

Due to lack of funds to grow her cassava, Nary decided to request a loan with VisionFund. She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle already, and she paid back her past loan completely. The previous loan helped her to have a better house to stay in than before.

She will spend this second loan in order to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow her crop well. She hopes to sell it for a good profit so that she can upgrade her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow her crop well so that she can sell it at a better price to increase her returns.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David con 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en casa propia de material rústico,en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. David cliente cuenta con muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad. Los habitantes de esta localidad en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

David se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café,con una experiencia en el rubro de 4 años. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha. De esta manera lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.

Socio recurrente. Firma con cónyugue.
texts.en:
David is 34 years old and lives with his wife and children. They live in their own house made of rustic materials which is in the district of Pucará, in the province of Jaén which is part of Cajamarca in Peru. David has very good personal and work references in his community. The people that live in this area primarily work in agriculture, business and cattle rearing.

David earns his living through farming, specifically cultivating coffee with 4 years of experience in this field. The loan that he is asking for will be used for his farm work, applying and using pesticides, fertilisers, and labour costs for harvest time. This will help him to improve his crop physiologically, morphologically and productively, as well as having a timely harvest. To this end he will also have greater production, a better quality product and so he will not have any problems in selling his product.

David is a repeat borrower who co-signs the loan with his wife.

loans.use: to continue farming and to apply and use pesticides and fertilisers.

loans.name: Nieve Alba

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Nieve, tiene 56 años de edad, está separada, pero  de esa relación tuvo cinco hijos, 4  mayores de edad, y el menor de 11 años el cual estudia en escuela que aun vive con ella.
Doña Nieve es una mujer que le toca trabajar muy duro para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, todos los días en la madrugada se va hasta la ciudad  de Manta, allí  compra el mejor pescado  a comerciantes mayoristas para luego llevar a vender al mercado de la ciudad en el cual tiene un puesto, ya son más de 35 años dedicada a esta actividad y espera seguir por muchos años mas ahora con la ayuda de los créditos.
Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener un local grande y propio.
texts.en:
The loan group Calle América (America Street) meets every fifteen days in Canton Montecristi. It is known nationally and internationally for its rich pre-colonial culture and craftsmanship of famous straw hats.

Nieve lives in this place and is 56 years old. She is separated and has five children; 4 adults and the youngest at 11 years old who studies in school and still lives with her.

Nieve works very hard to get ahead. She sells fish every day at dawn as far as the city of Manta. There, she buys the best fish from the wholesalers. She then sells them in the city market where she has a stall. She has been in this business for more than 35 years and hopes to continue for many more years with the help of the loans.

This loan is to buy fish. She has been in the credit group for 2 years. She likes it because the loans help her a lot. His dream is to have a big place of her own.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian esta estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Agronoma, por medio de sus estudios quiere poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que necesitan para una buena vida, el comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello pudo continuar a sus estudios.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder volver a pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo y agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Cristian is studying for a degree in Agricultural Engineering. Through his studies, he wants to be able to help his loved ones by providing them everything they need to have a good life. He says that with his previous loan, he was able to pay his degree fees and continue his studies.

Today Cristian is requesting a new loan so that he can pay his degree fees once again. This will allow him to continue his studies just as before. He is grateful for this new opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to pay his degree fees.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stall for her fruit-vending business.

Letecia has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from a general store.

Letecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in her fruit stall

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 43 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Ana Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ana Maria has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Ana Maria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marienila

texts.en: Marienila is a married woman, 46 years old, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marienila has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Marienila requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more nipa to sell in her stall. Marienila has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more nipa to sell to her stall

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with three children. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them. Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk food, personal product care, and other groceries. Elizabeth has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business. In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, junk food, personal product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is 44 years old and has five children. Carmen is married and has three children who are currently in school. Carmen is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Carmen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Carmen has been in the pig fattening business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Carmen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 24-year-old single man who started three years ago working as a freelance photographer to cover the needs and expenses of his family that consists of three members. He is a very talented and creative man who has his own loyal customers. Hussein is working hard to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a motorcycle and legally register it to facilitate his business transportation.
Hussein hopes to expand his business more in the future through opening his own shop to increase his income and increase his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and legally register it to facilitate his business transportation

loans.name: Vallecito Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VALLECITO”.
La socia es la  Sra. Rosa,  la socia continua con su  negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, golosinas, menestras, arroz entre otros.
Los  socios agradecen y valoran el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Vallencito”. Sra. Rosa is part of this group. She continues to manage a grocery store and sells merchandise to customers who request her products. Rosa is a responsible and diligent individual. She has been in this business for quite some time and it has given her personal satisfaction. This has allowed her to help her family get ahead. Rosa is requesting a loan in order to buy oil, snack foods, stews, rice, and other products.

All of the members appreciate and value the support that has been given to them in this manner. Therefore, they promise to complete their loan payments according to the established terms. The members who appear in the attached photos requested permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons. The person whose face is covered is not a member of the Communal Bank.

loans.use: to buy oil, snack foods, stews, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Halo - N13Thưnghlộc Group

texts.en: Mrs. Nhung is 32 years old and she is married with 2 children. She has been operating a food stall selling seafood for more than 10 years. Nhung lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. This region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. Therefore, the income from sea products businesses is unstable. It is really difficult for her to cover life expenses and to save money. The main hardship that Nhung faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh seafood to resell. In 2010, Nhung joined the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Nhung has successfully repaid 4 loans from the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the "Halo - N13THưngHLộc", which consists of 4 members. In the future, Nhung hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh seafood to resell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Luz requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Luz has been in this business for three years now.

Luz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Emelia is borrowing PHP 12,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, spices, etc., for her food-vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 37 years old and married with five children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. Maricel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

Maricel has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: As a married parent of five children, Melinda works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling animal feed. Melinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her stall. Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell in her stall

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a terribly hard working person in the vein of seeing his business flourishing, so as to improve the standards of living of his family. He operates a milling machine, predominantly milling rice and maize. In addition he carries out buying and selling of maize and beans for an extra income.

He imagines growing and expanding his business so as to become the main supplier of maize and beans in the areas surrounding him. The progress of his business is hindered by a poor road network. He is in quest of a loan facility to buy more maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy more maize for sell.

loans.name: Soklim

texts.en:
Soklim is a 32-year-old, married factory worker with two children in her care. She has been a worker since 2010, earning around $7 per day. One of her children attends school, and her husband earns his main income from cutting grass to sell, earning around $7 per day as well. All of them live in the Takeo Province of Cambodia.

Now Soklim is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle with a trailer for her husband to transport grass to sell. This loan will help her husband earn more income to support her family. In the future, she is going to buy a small Korean truck for transporting grass to sell, build a new proper house and support her children to go through high school, and if possible, university.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle with a trailer for her husband to transport grass to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es:
Vivian es de la ciudad de Itá, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, vive con sus padres quienes siempre le dan su apoyo en sus sueños.
Ella tiene como meta poder recibirse y ser un profesional útil a la sociedad. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Vivian is from the city of Itá and is studying for a degree in Business Administration. She lives with her parents who have always been supportive of her dreams.

Vivian’s goal is to receive her degree and become a useful professional in society. She is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees, which will allow her to continue her studies. Vivian appreciates this opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano desde hace 7 años, su negoio esta ubicado en una zona muy transitada cerca de su casa y ya tiene muchos clientes, la joven vive en casa propia con su hija y su esposo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y tambien zapatos y juguetes para aumentar la mercaderia y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixelated is 23 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past seven years. Her business is located in a very busy area near her house and she has many customers. The young woman lives in her own home along with her husband and daughter.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothing in bulk, as well as shoes and toys. This will increase her merchandise so that she can generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk, as well as shoes and toys.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma and her husband are engaged in fishing business to earn a living. She also buys and sells frozen goods to have additional income. She has been doing this for a year to enhance their livelihood. Thus, she is asking a loan for boat maintenance and to buy frozen goods such as hotdogs, chorizo and sweetened pork to sell. In the future, Thelma wishes to improve their means of living and have a sustainable life. She is a 43-year-old woman and has four children that still in needs of their support. The oldest child is 19 years old while the youngest child is eight years old.

loans.use: for boat maintenance and to buy frozen goods such as hotdogs, chorizo and sweetened pork

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 36 years old and has three children. Melanie is married, and two of her children are in school.

Melanie is in the agricultural business of farming corn in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Melanie has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: M. Azam

texts.en:
M. Azam is 37 years old and the father of two children. He owns a small firm in which he has compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic PVC flexible pipes. He employs laborers to work the molding machines on daily wages. For the manufacturing of different sizes PVC pipes, he needs different categories and qualities of raw materials.

This time he has taken a huge contract but does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw materials to continue his manufacturing. Therefore, M. Azam has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy plastic crushing raw materials for the molding machines.

After completion of this contract, he can easily make some savings to meet the sudden needs or incidents. He is very thankful to Kiva and supporting lenders.

loans.use: to buy plastic crushing raw material for his PVC flexible pipe manufacturing business. .

loans.name: Marlene

texts.fr: Marlene, âgée de 58 ans, est divorcée et mère d’un enfant scolarisé. Cela fait 3 ans qu’elle vend des sous-vêtements au marché de Gressier. Entrepreneure courageuse et motivée, Marlène travaille constamment au développement de son activité et s'appuie sur le microcrédit pour se procurer davantage de marchandise à vendre. Elle désire agrandir son commerce et épargner pour les études de son enfant.
texts.en: Marlene, age 58, is the divorced mother of a child who goes to school. She has been selling undergarments at the Gressier market for the past 3 years. She is a courageous and motivated businesswoman who works tirelessly to sustain her activity. She relies on micro-financing to bolster her stock of merchandise to sell. Her goals are to expand her business and to save for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy undergarments for resale.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is a 27 year old married lady with 3 children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has a retail shop that she operates seven days a week and eight hours daily. In addition, she owns a dairy farm, where she produces milk for selling.

She has future prospects of becoming a wholesaler in her village and wishes to educate all her children to higher levels of learning. She has asked for a loan to add more stock of sugar, salt, bread, cooking oil and soap for sale.

loans.use: to add more stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap for sell.

loans.name: Ancha

texts.pt:
A senhora  Ancha de 25 anos de idade, é comerciante e mãe solteira de 2 filhos. 1 ainda menor outro no ensino primário vive na casa de seus pais.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo  pretende comprar  cimento, barrotes, portas, areia, pedra, varões, para iniciar com a construção de sua casa num espaço que seus pais lhe cederam.
O seu sonho é  terminar a obra, adquirir bens para seu o bem estar e crescer no negocio.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para superá-los conta com ajuda de seus pais  e que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Ancha, 25, is a businesswoman and a single mother. She has two children; one is still very young, and the other one goes to primary school. She lives at her parents’.

She says that with the requested amount she is planning to buy cement, bars, doors, sand, stones, and beams to start building her house in a piece of land her parents gave her.

Her dream is to finish the construction works, buy some goods for her own well-being, and expand her business.

She says that her biggest challenge is the lack of funding, and her parents help her to overcome it. Also, that she will apply for more loans to realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy cement, bars, doors, sand, stones, and beams.

loans.name: Mercelita

texts.en:
Mercelita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercelita is 43 years old, and one child is still in school.

Mercelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercelita requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnet, bamboo and other fishing materials.

Mercelita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishnet, bamboo and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Airis

texts.en:
Airis is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling of Avon and Natasha products business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase more products from Avon and Natasha to sell to her customers.

Airis has been in this business for two years. Airis earns additional income from selling peanut butter.

Airis has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products from Avon and Natasha to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 56 years old and single.

Shirley is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Shirley has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 55 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, eggs, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a married woman, 57 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mildred has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay for additional cloth, thread, needle, zippers and maintenance for her sewing machine.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for additional cloth, thread, needle, zippers and maintenance for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 39 years old and married.

She is in the agricultural pig fattening business in the Philippines. Ana Marie requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

Ana Marie has been in the pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ana Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her business.

loans.name: Telma

texts.pt:
A senhora Telma de 34 anos de idade é empregada doméstica, casada, mãe de 2 filhos todos a estudarem, não sustenta mais ninguém e vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo  irá comprar  cimento, blocos, barrotes para dar continuidade a sua obra.
O seu sonho é fazer um salão de cabeleireiro na sua casa para reforçar a renda as família.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para superá-los  conta com ajuda do seu esposo que  trabalha na Africa do Sul e que ira solicitar mais empréstimos para para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Telma, 34, works as a housekeeper. She is married and the mother of two children; all of them go to school. She is not responsible for anyone else and lives in a house she owns.

She says that with the requested amount she will buy cement, bricks, and bars to continue with the construction works.

Her dream is to open a beauty salon at home to strengthen the family’s income.

She says that her biggest challenge is the lack of funding, and that her husband, who works in South Africa, helps her to overcome it. Also, that she will apply for more loans to realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, and bars.

loans.name: Constantino

texts.pt:
O senhor  Constantino é comerciante, casado é pai de 3 filhos dos quais 2 já maiores 1 ainda a estudar no ensino primário vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo  pretende comprar  cimento, barrotes, portas, areia, pedra, varões, para dar continuidade a sua obra.
O seu sonho é  terminar a obra e fazer o muro de vedação de seu quintal e adquirir uma viatura para uso pessoal.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para superá-los conta com ajuda de sua esposa que é comerciante e que ira solicitar mais empréstimos para para concretizar os seus planos.
texts.en:
Constantino is a businessman. He is married, and the father of three children; two of them are adults, and the other one still goes to primary school. He owns the house where he lives.

He says that with the requested amount he is planning to buy cement, bars, doors, sand, stones, and beams to continue with the construction works.

His dream is to finish the construction works, build a division wall in his yard, and buy a vehicle for his personal use.

He says that his biggest challenge is the lack of funding, and that his wife, who is a businesswoman, helps him to overcome it. Also, that he will apply for more loans to realize his dreams.

loans.use: to buy cement, bars, doors, sand, stones, and beams.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia continua con sus estudios de licenciatura, esta poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de sus estudios, comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda para sus estudios y para poder cubrirlos.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo de vuelta en el pago de sus cuotas y agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Patricia continues her undergraduate studies and is doing her best to improve her living conditions as a result of her education. She says that with her previous loan, she was able to invest in the payment of her fees. Since she was able to cover them, the loan was a great help for her studies.

Today Patricia is requesting a new loan so that she can invest in the payment of her fees once again. She appreciates this new opportunity she has received in order to become a professional.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking female entrepreneur with one child.  She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like selling frozen foods.  Mercedita dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old, single, and has two children.  She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Myrna is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds, and other farm supplies.

Myrna has been in this business for 5 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.  She is working tirelessly to attain her dream, which is to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is 24 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school.  She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.  Aiza requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for 5 years now, and she has previously borrowed from NWTF three times to sustain her business.  Aiza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 50 years old, married, and has eight children, two of whom are currently in school.  She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.  Susana requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccinations, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Susana has been in this business for 4 years now, and she has previously borrowed from NWTF two times to sustain her business.  In the future, Susana would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccinations, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Mirlande

texts.fr: Mirlande a 34 ans. Elle a 3 enfants. Pour subvenir aux besoins de son foyer, elle vend à son domicile des produits alimentaires aux habitants de son quartier. Elle demande un microcrédit afin d'augmenter son stock et de faire face à la demande. A l’avenir, elle espère économiser suffisamment pour offrir une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Mirlande, age 34, is the mother of three children. To help support her household, she sells food products to local residents from her home. She is seeking a loan to bolster her stock and meet customer demand. In the long term, she hopes to save enough for her children to receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy bags of yellow sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and bars.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 56 years old, married and has two children. Now he lives in the Fuzuli region with his family, where they are IDP (internally displaced persons) from Fuzuli city. His daughter is a teacher now. Murad has been in the cattle business for a year. His salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses.

Murad has applied to Komak company. At present he needs 2000 AZN(Azerbaijan New Manat) in order to buy cows to increase the milk level production. Murad uses the milk to prepare cheese, yogurt and sells these products to stores. He is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for their help.

loans.use: to buy cows to increase his milk level production to help support his family

loans.name: Clemencue Group

texts.en:
Laila, aged 39, ia the single mother of one child, is the featured borrower of the Clemencue group, which consists of two other Filipino members, Army and Merly. The three of them left their home towns to come and work as housekeepers in Lebanon, hoping to meet the needs of their beloved families at home and offer them a better future. Laila is pictured at right, with Meryl in the center and Army on the left.

The three of them have decided to hold hands and together acquire a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. They have become best friends and have learned to trust each other ever since arriving to work in Lebanon. They all share the ambition of raising their families' standard of living back in the Philippines.

Laila is the mother of one child, and she works hard to support her child's basic needs and to offer him the best education she can, as her goal is to give him a brighter future.

However, her current monthly income is barely enough to cover her own survival. For this reason, her acquired loan funds will be sent to her beloved child in the Philippines in order to pay for the increasing school tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her child's increasing school tuition fees in the Philippines.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is 56 years old, married, and lives in Amulung with his wife and children.  He manage a small store.  He wanted to increase his sales, so he is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy noodles, eggs, bread, canned goods, and biscuits to sell.  He will continue selling good products and services to all his customers and hopes to save funds for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy noodles, eggs, bread, canned goods, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Arcadio

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive don Carlos,  tiene 52 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos mayores de edad, todos aún viven en su casa. Su esposa trabaja en una fábrica.
El señor Carlos es un hombre muy trabajador que realiza lo que sea para sacar adelante a su familia, el se  dedica al comercio, vende pescado,  el compra a los pescadores que llegan de alta mar hasta las playas en Manta, para  luego llevar a vender a otras ciudades donde entrega al por mayor a otros comerciantes minoristas, el también entrega los peces a fabricas atuneras en la ciudad con lo cual se gana algo aunque más ganancias le deja ir vendiendo por libras lo cual también lo realiza uno a dos días por semana, ya son más de 30 años que lleva en esta actividad razón por lo cual cuenta con muy buena clientela que siempre le compran sus productos.
Este crédito es para ir a comprar pescado en muchas variedades. Lleva más de 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son tener un camión.
texts.en:
The Crédito Calle América group meets every fifteen days in the Cantón Montecristi, a place known nationally and internationally for its rich precolonial culture and its handicrafts -- the place of the famous straw hats. This is where Carlos lives. He is 52 and married, and from his marriage has produced three grown children, all of whom still live at home. His wife works in a factory.

Carlos is a very hardworking man, who does what he can to to move his family forward. He works in business, selling fish. He buys the fish from the fishermen that arrive from the high seas to the beaches of Manta. He then takes the fish to other cities where he sells them wholesale to other retail salesmen. He also sells fish to the tuna factories in the city, from which he earns a bit more, but he earns more selling by the pound, which he also does one or two days a week. Because he's been in this business for more than 30 years, he has very good customers who always buy from him.

This loan is to buy fish of many kinds. Carlos has been in the Grupo de Crédito for more than 4 years, and likes it because the loans are quick and provide much support. His dream is to have a truck.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 38-year-old woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is a married woman and has four children ages 14, 11, 8 and 1 year old. Lucy and her husband earn a living by doing fishing business. They have been doing this business for 15 years. They need loans to help them uplift their livelihood.

Through the money she is asking, they were able to buy fishing nets and a new engine for their fishing boat to enhance their catch. In the future, Lucy wants to be successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and new engine for their fishing boat.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy lives in a town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines, were most people in the community earn a living by doing fishing business. Mercy and her husband are one of those communities who are engaged in this business to sustain their daily needs. They have been doing this for almost 25 years.

Mercy is taking a loan to buy fishing nets and to buy plywood for boat repair to enhance their catch. Thus, she dreams in the future to improve their livelihood and have sustainable means of living. In addition, Mercy is 39 years old and a mother of six children. Her oldest child is 20 years old while her youngest child is one year old.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and pay for plywood for boat repair.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like beauty products retail business.

Josefina dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en: Tarcela is 49 years old and married with three children. One child is still in school, Tarcela works very hard to provide for them. For two years she has operated a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, soap, and personal care products. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: Leonisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. Leonisa earns more income from food vending. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 66 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Dolores has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, spices, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Dolores would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is 33 years old and the father of four children. He owns a small firm in which he has a compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories and employs laborers for his molding machines on daily wages.

His practice is to buy crushing raw material from the market and put it into the injection molding machine. The raw material melts under high temperatures and he then injects it into the dies through compression, for giving specific shapes. In this way he manufactures plastic accessories, then sells them in the market.

Now he has taken a huge contract, larger than before, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy additional crushed raw material to continue his manufacturing.
Therefore, Amin has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can buy crushed plastic raw material for his molding machine.

He has to bear household expenses including the children's school fees, diet and health. For these purposes He needs a large income and he is only person who is responsible for bearing the household expenses.

Amin is very happy after receiving this loan and thanks Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crushed plastic raw material, so he can fulfill the huge contract to make articles in plastic and generate income for his family.

loans.name: Nin's Group

texts.en:
Nin is 34 years old living in a small house in Sandan district of Kampong Thom province and the mother of three children, one of whom is in school. To make a living, she does rice farming for 10 years. The crop has not grown well so that she has lower outputs, so it is really hard for her to support the whole family.

She is leading a group of three women and willing to manage her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. This is Nin’s first loan with VisionFund. She hopes that all family members are healthy and it will prevent her children from infectious diseases.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine to improve her family's living condition and prevent her children from infectious diseases.

loans.name: Cinthia Nancy

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Cinthia, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad, la mayor esta en jardín de infantes. Su esposo trabaja en local comercial de la localidad.
Doña Cinthia es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios recursos por el bien de su familia, ella espera utilizar este crédito para surtir una pequeña tienda de víveres ya que cuenta con el espacio suficiente en su  en su casa,  allí espera de a poco ir vendiendo los productos de primera necesidad y algún día tener una gran tienda, este tipo de negocios puede ser un éxito ya que no hay muchas tiendas cerca por lo cual espera vender mucho
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir su tienda, va a comprar víveres de consumo. Lleva  en el Grupo De Crédito 5 años y le gusta porque los créditos son muy buenos. Sus sueños son tener un gran negocio y brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Calle América meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich culture and artisan goods, which are recognized at national and international levels. It is the place of famous toquilla straw hats.

In this place lives Señora Cinthia. She is 34 years old, is married, and has two children ages 4 and two years old. Her older child is in kindergarten. Her husbands works in the local commerce zone of the community.

Doña Cinthia is a woman who likes to manage herself on her own and earn her own resources for the wellbeing of her family. She hopes to use this credit to stock a small store of provisions now that she has enough space in her home. From there, she hopes to go little by little selling products that are basic necessities. One day, she hopes to have a big store; this type of business could be a success because there are not many stores nearby and for this reason, she hopes to sell a lot.

This loan will be used to stock her store; she will purchase consumer goods. She has been part of the Credit Group Calle America for five years and she likes it because the loans are very good. Her dreams are to have a large business and deliver the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase provisions

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a sari-sari store owner from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has four children ages 19, 17, 14 and 12 years old. Her husband is a seaman who works hard to provide the needs of their family. Violeta has been running her sari-sari store business for two years. She is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, chips, biscuits, candies and soft drinks. She also plans to buy piglets. Perhaps, she is thinking to raise pigs for additional income. In the future, she dreams to uplift their livelihood

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, chips, biscuits, candies and soft drinks; piglets

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a produce business man. In 2011 he started a business with a purpose of fighting poverty and earning a living. He lives in Kagadi–Uganda. He also trades in waragi (alcohol) as the alternative source of income and now he needs money to add to his stock of maize and cassava.

Emmanuel has a dream of becoming rich, however his challenge is price fluctuation of produce. Emmanuel lives a single life. He used the previous loan to buy maize and cassava for resale a loan that he was able to pay well and get good profits.

loans.use: to buy maize and cassava for resale.

loans.name: Mamy Rosette

texts.fr:
Mamy Rosette est une mère de trois enfants de 39 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés. Elle est mariée et son mari aussi est commerçant comme elle. Il vend des chaussures à l'occasion.
Auparavant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche mais ne supportait pas le travail de nuit, elle  devait même être hospitalisée à cause de la fatigue. Donc, elle a dû démissionner. Depuis 2013, elle décidait d'exploiter un petit commerce de friperie, et elle trouvait une petite place à côté de sa cousine qui vend des sacs  dames à l'occasion. Sa priorité, en ce moment est le développement de son activité, et le prêt en est un moyen pour y parvenir. Le but est d'augmenter le revenu afin de pouvoir améliorer la condition de vie de la famille.
texts.en:
Mamy Rosette is a 39-year old mother of three children. They all attend school. She is married and her husband also is a trader like her. He sells used shoes.

Before, she worked in a free zone enterprise but could not handle night work, she even had to be hospitalised due to fatigue. So, she had to resign. Since 2013, she decided to exploit a small used clothes business, and she found a little spot next to her cousin who sells used ladies' bags.

Her priority at the moment is the development of her activity, and a loan is one way to achieve this. The goal is to increase her income in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy two bals of used clothes.

loans.name: Ilo Ilo Sisters Group

texts.en:
Rosalie is the featured borrower of Ilo Ilo Sisters. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they came to work in Lebanon in order to provide for their families' costs of living.

Rosalie is a 50-year-old married mother of three children, who works as a housekeeper in Lebanon to cover her family's needs. Rosalie is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to send money for her children back in Philippines, to pay for their education expenses.

Rosalie is a hard worker who is working to save money in order to go back one day and unite with her beloved family. She is trying to establish her own business and develop her family's living conditions.

Rosalie is the second lady from the right with pink and yellow top.
As for the other members, Salvacion is the second from the left sitting in the picture, Juliet is the first lady standing at the left, while Twinkle is the first lady from the right.

loans.use: to send money for her children back in Philippines to pay for their education expenses

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo is a resident in the town of Carmen, Bohol. He is fifty-two years old, married with five children. His eldest child is 22, while the youngest is 12.
He earns a living by raising and selling pigs. In addition to hog raising, he also does farming. He toils the land and grows rice.

He decided to take a loan to buy supplies for the farm like fertilizers and pig feed. These are basic tool for the improvement of his both sources of income. Thus, his field will generate higher yield and at the same time he could sell quality hogs.
Thus, he could support the needs of his family and be able to expand both livelihoods to become more successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy suppliesfor the farm like fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: María Del Rocio

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Sociedad Metropolitana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Maria, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  16, 9 y 4 años de edad,  todos  estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María es una gran mujer que siempre trata de ayudar a  su marido en sus actividades, ella realiza el crédito y junto a su esposo  lo utilizan en su negocio, ellos se dedican a la venta de  frutas más que todo frutas de la región como naranjas, mandarinas, mangos, piñas, sandias, entre otras, mientras el recorre la ciudad en un triciclo ella vende en un puesto que tienen  en su casa. Llevan más de  12 años con esta actividad la cual les permite ganarse la vida honradamente.
Este crédito es para comprar naranjas, mandarinas, mangos, piñas, sandias y otras frutas. Lleva 12 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio el cual les permite ganarse la vida. Sus sueños son tener un carro para salir a vender.
texts.en:
The credit group Sociedad Metropolitana meets every two weeks in the Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are recognized at the national and international level. It is home to the famous straw "toquilla" hats.

Maria lives there. She is 33 years old, is married, and from this relationship she has three children who are 16, 9, and 4 years old. All of her children are in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Maria is a great woman who always tries to help her husband with his work. She requests the loans and together with her husband, they use it for their business. They sell fruit, specifically fruits from the region like oranges, mandarins, mangos, pineapples, watermelons, and other fruits. While he goes throughout the city in a tricycle, she sells in a stall they have in their home. They have been doing this work for more than 12 years and it allows them to make an honest living.

This loan will be used to buy oranges, mandarins, mangos, pineapples, watermelons, and other fruits. She has been in this credit group for 12 years and she likes it because she started her business thanks to the loans and the business allows them to make a living. Her dream is to have a car so that she can go out and sell.

loans.use: to buy oranges, mandarins, mangos, pineapples, watermelons and other fruits.

loans.name: Inday

texts.en:
Inday is 39 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Inday has a general store business in the Philippines. Inday requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Inday has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Inday would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 36 years old and married, with three children.

Angeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Angeline has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Angeline aspires to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is 50 years old and widowed with six children.

She earns a living running a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Bienvenida is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Bienvenida has been in pig fattening for two years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elisa is 47 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Elisa has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, so now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elisa has been in this business for 21 years. Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vololonoro

texts.fr:
54 ans, mariée, Vololonoro est une mère de trois enfants dont les deux garçons sont déjà mariés, et sa fille qui a 18 ans et est encore à sa charge  étudie à l'université.
Auparavant, elle travaillait comme employée de bureau et avait des relations avec des touristes et des étrangers. Depuis 2012, elle décidait de démissionner et entrer dans le métier de vente des arts malagasy. Ces dites relations sont devenues des clients. En plus ses articles sont de bonnes qualités. Elle voudrait autant que possible diversifier les articles à proposer , développer  et améliorer son affaire d'où l'explication de sa demande de crédit.
texts.en:
54 years old, married, Vololonoro is a mother of three children whose two sons are already married, and whose daughter who is 18 years old and still in her care studies at university.

In the past, she worked as an office worker and had relations with tourists and strangers. Since 2012, she decided to resign and started the business of malagasy craft sales. These relations became clients. Furthermore, her items are of good quality.

She would like as much as possible to diversify the articles for sale, to develop and improve her business, which explains her request for a loan.

loans.use: to buy different types of Malagasy art items: sets of baskets, tablecloths, beach mats, hats, etc

loans.name: Vololomboahangy

texts.fr:
Vololomboahangy est une femme dynamique et travailleuse de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et il travaille au bureau de la commune urbaine de la capitale, et le salaire est un peu faible. Ils ont ensemble trois enfants, l'ainée qui a 18 ans est déjà marié,  et les deux autres (15 et 8 ans) sont encore à leur charge.
Pour aider son mari à entretenir et soutenir sa famille, elle exploite un petit stand d'alimentation (du riz avec accompagnement: des plats typiquement malagasy), il y a maintenant 12 ans. Avant cette gargote, elle vendait des ustensiles en plastiques, pour dire qu'elle possède tant d'années d'expérience dans le domaine du commerce. Son souhait est de développer et améliorer son activité, elle voudrait que ça devient un petit restaurant dans un local fermé un jour.
texts.en:
Vololomboahangy is a dynamic and hardworking 37-year old woman. She is married and he works at the office of the capital's urban community, and the salary is a bit low. Together they have three children, the eldest who is 18 years old is already married, and the other two (15 and 8 years) are still in their care.

To help her husband to take care of and support her family, she works at a small food stall (rice with accompaniment: typical Malagasy dishes), for twelve years now. Before this shop, she sold plastic utensils, this is to say she possesses so many years' experience in the field of business.

Her wish is to develop and improve her activity, she would like it to become a small restaurant in enclosed premises one day.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal, pots, vegetables

loans.name: Rith's Group

texts.en: Rith’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rith works as farmer and he also does extra work as teacher to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 45-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; her children love her a lot due to her caring.

Currently, Shahnaz owns a dairy farm at her home, since 1990. She produces milk with the help of an appointed assistant. She is growing old and does not have enough energy to perform her tasks as she use to do in young age.

A few days ago one of her cattle was stolen, due to a lack of security and there is not proper shelter for her cattle, which is needs to be improved. This loss is highly affecting upon her monthly income. She wants to buy a buffalo and maintain a cowshed, but she has insufficient savings. Therefor, Shahnaz requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, to buy a buffalo, so she can carry on her business smoothly.

From the profit amount, Shahnaz will ensure the security for her cattle, build the shelter for her cattle, so that she can minimize the security risk.
Shahnaz is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for producing milk and can minimize security risk for her cattle.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath, 30, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She is married and has two children, one is too young for school while another one is in school. For the last eight years, Sambath has been raising ducks and farming rice. Low crop yields resulted from drought has been the main challenge for her business.  
Sambath has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for seven cycles already and she completely repaid the loans. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for another loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more ducks for raising. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make living better.

loans.use: to buy more ducks for raising

loans.name: Puon's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Battambang province, Puon is 39 years old and she has four dependent children, one of whom is a schoolchild.

For ten years, to support her family’s living condition, she catches fish and works for others for a fee. She can earn income about USD 11 per day. After expenses, she is able to save around USD 3 each day.

Recently, her fishing business was faced with a problem because she could not catch as many fish as before.

The previous five loans, which have helped her to improve her family’s living, were fully repaid. Now, Puon is leading a group, which consists of three members, to apply for a new loan via VisionFund Cambodia and she will use her loan portion to buy a boat and fishing materials to support her business. She hopes to earn good income, so that she has enough ability to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Verónica Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 41 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no ha podido tener hijos. El marido trabaja en un bar. 
Doña Verónica es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y así poder sentirse independiente, ella es maestra y trabaja en un colegio de la localidad, pero además de esto ella también se dedica al comercio, ella vende  ropa de todo tipo, cremas, bisuterías, perfumes y muchos otros productos más, ella tiene unas vitrinas en su casa lugar en el cual le ayuda su mamá con sus ventas,  ella  también vende en el colegio que trabaja ya que allí cuenta con muy buena clientela, deja a crédito y cobra todas las semanas. Tiene más 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se algo extra. 
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, cremas, perfumes y otras prendas. Lleva 8 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con uno de los créditos ella financia su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un  hijo.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Calle América meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and artisanship, recognized at both the national and international levels. It is the birthplace of the famous Panama hat.

This is where Verónica lives. She is 41 years old. She is in a common-law relationship but has not yet been able to have children. Her husband works in a bar.

Doña Verónica is a very hard-working woman who likes to earn her own living and feel independent. She is a teacher, working in a school in the same locality, but in addition to this, she is a businessperson. She sells all kinds of clothing, creams, costume jewelry, and perfume, as well as many other products. She has several showcases in her home, from which her mother helps her with sales. She also sells at the school where she works, and where she has a very good clientele--she sells on credit and charges weekly. She has been earning something extra this way for more than 10 years.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, blouses, creams, perfumes, and other goods. She has been in the Credit Group for 8 years and likes it, because she finances her business with one of their loans. Her dreams are to have a child.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, blouses, creams, perfumes, and other goods.

loans.name: Heart Stone Group

texts.en:
Anita is the featured borrower of Heart Stone group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they left their hometown Philippine to come and work in Lebanon, for a better income to support their beloved ones back in Philippine.

Anita is a 45-year-old married mother of four who is working hard to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions at home. Thus she is acquiring a Loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her family's house in the Philippine.

Anita is the first lady on the right of the photo. Remelinda is the second lady on the right, Marisa is the second lady on the left, and Jennifer is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her family's house in Philippine

loans.name: Yajaira Lisseth

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Yajaira, tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 6, 3 y de 7 meses el menor, la mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Yajaira es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así generar sus propios ingresos que les ayuden a salir adelante junto a su familia, ella tiene un local el cual arrienda en la ciudad y que está bien ubicado para sus ventas, allí vende frutas, legumbres, arroz, azúcar y otros víveres que le sirven para ir satisfaciendo  las necesidades de sus clientes  que a diario acuden a su local a comprar sus productos, así ella se gana la vida y está atenta a las necesidades de sus pequeños que requieren de muchos cuidados, lleva más de 2 años con este negocio el cual le deja muy buenos beneficios.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar frutas, legumbres, arroz y otros víveres. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella cada vez aumenta su negocio. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The Calle America Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the canton of Montecristi, known for its rich precolonial culture and its artisan crafts, which are renown on a national and international level. Home of the famous straw hats.

Here lives Ms. Yajaira, 22 years old and in an open union in which she has three children, ages 6 years, and 3 and 7 months old. The oldest is in school. Her partner is a merchant.

Ms. Yajaira is a woman who values herself and wants to generate her own income to help her family get ahead. She rents a small home in the city and is well positioned for sales. There she sells fruits, vegetables, rice, sugar and other provisions that satisfy the needs of her customers, who daily come into her home to buy her products. This is how she is able to make a living while looking after her little ones who require a lot of care. She has spent more than 2 years in this business which has provided her great benefits.

This loan will be used to buy fruit, vegetables, rice and other provisions. She has been involved with the Calle America Credit Group for 4 cycles and is happy that each loan has enhanced her business. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, rice and other provisions

loans.name: Selena Marilin

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Sociedad Metropolitana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Selena, tiene 19 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 10 meses  de edad. Su marido es ebanista.
Doña Selena es una joven mujer que le gusta colaborar con algo en pro de su hogar, ella realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su labor, el  junto a su padre  tienen  un taller de ebanistería en la localidad, allí  elaboran muebles de sala, comedor,  camas, anaqueles, puertas y todo lo que sus clientes le soliciten, ellos trabajan por pedidos que sus clientes le realizan, los prefieren por la calidad de sus trabajos y por la seriedad a la hora de entregar sus obras, el lleva 5 años en esta actividad la cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario para él y su familia.
Este crédito es para  comprar madera, pinturas y otros materiales necesarios para elaborar los muebles. Lleva más de un año en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los  créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su bebé.
texts.en:
The credit group Sociedad Metropolitana meets every two weeks in the Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are recognized at the national and international level. It is the home of the famous straw "toquilla" hats.

Selena lives there. She is 19 years old and is in a relationship from which she has a son who is 10 months old. Her husband is a woodworker.

Selena is a young woman who likes to contribute something positive to her home. She is requesting this loan so that her husband can use it for his work. Together with his father, he has a woodworking shop in their town. They make living room furniture, dinning tables, beds, shelves, doors, and everything that their customers request. They do their work to-order as requested by their customers. They are preferred because of the quality of their work and because they deliver their work on time. He has been doing this work for five years and it allows him to support himself and his family.

This loan will be used to buy wood, paints, and other materials needed to make furniture. She has been in this credit group for more than a year and she likes it because the loans are very helpful. Her dream is to provide something better for her baby.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints, and other materials.

loans.name: Neris Emperatriz

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Sociedad Metropolitana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Neris, tiene 49 años de edad, hace ya varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esa relación tiene 2  hijos de 29 y 22 años de edad, ambos aun vive en casa.
Doña Neris es una  mujer que le gusta trabajar y así ganarse lo suyo para salir adelante, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y joyas hechas en plata, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, sale tres o cuatro días por semana ya sea en la mañanas o tardes, no tiene horarios fijos si no cuando pueda, ella también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando quieren alguna prenda, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 o 15 días, ella cada vez que puede viaja a Cuenca a comprar las joyas ya que allá consigue más barato lo cual le permite mejorar sus ganancias Tiene más de 15 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana la vida.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, blusas, camisas, cadenas, anillos y aretes. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Credit Group Sociedad Metropolitana meets every 15 days in Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial history and its artisan goods, which are recognized at the national and international levels. It is the place of the famous straw toquilla hats.

In this place lives the señora Neris. She is 49 years old, she was widowed some years ago, and she has two children with her late husband, ages 29 and 22 years old. They both live at home.

Doña Neris is a woman who likes to work and this way, she her earns what's hers in order to move forward. She makes a living in commerce; she sells all types of clothing and jewelry made of silver. Her method of sales is door to door and she goes out three or four days a week in the mornings or the afternoons. She does not have fixed hours of work; she works when she can. She also sells her products from her home, where her clients come when they want an order. She sells to her clients on credit and she charges every 8 or 15 days. Whenever she can, she travels to Cuenca to purchase the jewelry because she can get the best prices in Cuenca, which allows to her to improve her earnings. She has been in the business for 15 years and it is how she earns a living.

This loan will be used to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, necklaces, rings, and earrings. She has been in the credit group since it began and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dream is to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, necklaces, rings, and earrings.

loans.name: Jezeibel

texts.en:
Jezeibel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now, borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Jezeibel dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 49 years old and widowed with four children. With one child currently in school, Marciana works very hard to provide for them.

Marciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell.

Marciana has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, cereals, etc. 

Marciana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, detergent soap, shampoo, sugar, coffee, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Bour's Group

texts.en:
Bour’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Bour makes a living cultivating rice, and she does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Annah lives in Kagadi –Uganda, she is 42 years old, married with 8 children. She trades in textiles as her major source of income a business, which she started in 2000 to generate income. She is located on a business street in town.

Annah has a dream of having a bigger business; she therefore wants more money to add on her stock, her major challenge is competition from other business men and women doing the same business.

loans.use: buy more textiles for making clothes, to support her large family.

loans.name: Syamsiah

texts.en:
Mrs Syamsiah is the mother of 2 children and lives in Tulangan, Sidoarjo Regency on the island of Java, the main island of Indonesia.

In Indonesia, like in many other developing nations, you need to treat water before you can drink it. Unsurprisingly, most Indonesians boil the water before they drink it. Some people also buy water from refill stations which is not always safe. Mrs Syamsiah heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs Syamsiah, who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This is the first time Mrs Syamsiah applies for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.
This loan will allow Mrs Syamsiah to buy 10 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 50 people.

loans.use: to obtain 10 water filters to sell to her neighbours providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Jovia,

texts.en:
Jovia is divorced and a mother of 3 and she is their only bread winner. She operates a retail shop and does farming as well. She is able to provide her children with their needs through income got from her farm and business.

Jovia would like to add stock to her shop, so that her income levels improve. The challenge is that she is limited by price fluctuations and insufficient capital. She is now requesting for money to buy sugar, pampers, among other items for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, pampers, among other items for selling.
