loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice, and she does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these individuals to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en:
San’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal Province in Cambodia. San makes a living cultivating rice, and she does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr:
Jean est un artisan talentueux de 53 ans. Il est marié et père de quatre enfants dont trois sont déjà grands et mariés, seul le dernier âgé de 15 ans est encore à sa charge.
Il fabrique des mini baby-foot il y a maintenant un an, à part les tirelires et les valises en pin qu'il fabriquait depuis très très longtemps. Les mini baby-foot sont ses nouveaux exploits, le baby-foot est parmi les jeux le plus apprécié dans le pays, sans distinction de classes sociales ni d'âges. C'est lui même qui crée et invente le modèle, il ne suivait pas de formation spéciale. Il est aidé par sa femme dans l'exercice de cette activité.
La famille est déjà propriétaire de sa petite maison d'habitation mais envisage quand même de faire une extension et s'efforce de faire des épargnes.
texts.en:
Jean is a talented 53-year old artist. He is married and father to four children of whom three are already grown and married, only the last aged 15 years is still in his care.

He has been building mini foosball tables for one year now, besides the piggy banks and pine suitcases he was building for a long, long time. The mini foosball tables are his new exploits, foosball is one of the most appreciated games in the country, with no distinction between social classes or age. He himself created and invented this model, he did not follow any special training. He is helped by his wife in carrying out this activity.

The family already owns its little house but still envisage building an extension and are trying to make savings.

loans.use: to buy nails, paints, ties, metal sheeting, etc...

loans.name: Azzaya

texts.en:
Mrs. Azzaya, 35 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a janitor at the police department for 11 years. Her husband repairs damaged cars at home. Their children go to secondary school.

Using her previous loan, she has renovated her house and created a comfortable place for her family. Now she is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to buy spare parts for her husband's business. Her husband has run out of spare parts used for repairing cars.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her husband's car repair business.

loans.name: Carlos Junior

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Sociedad Metropolitana se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive el señor Carlos, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en casa de sus padres, el estudia para Lic. En Ciencias De La Educación en Manta. 
Don Carlos es un joven muy trabajador que le gusta a base de esfuerzo y trabajo salir adelante y así irse forjando un mejor porvenir para cuando le toque forma su familia, el se  dedica al comercio, tiene un bar en las afueras de su casa el cual está al frente de un colegio de la localidad, allí el vende colas, jugos, aguas, chifles, ceviche de pescado, sanduches y otros alimentos que el con la ayuda de su mamá preparan, trabaja desde las 8h00 a 13h00 ya que después el tiene que asistir a la universidad en la cual estudia, el tiene un año este negocio.
Este crédito es para comprar jugos, colas y víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le agrada porque gracias a los créditos él puede salir adelante en su negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida. Sus sueños es tener su título universitario.
texts.en:
The credit group Sociedad Metropolitana meets every two weeks in the Cantón Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are recognized at the national and international level. It is the home of the famous straw "toquilla" hats.

Carlos lives there. He is 21 years old and is single. He lives at home with his parents and is studying for a degree in science education in Manta.

Carlos is a very hardworking young man who likes to get ahead with hard work and effort so that he can forge a better future for when he forms his family. He works as a merchant. He has a stall outside of his home which faces a local school. There he sells soft drinks, juices, water, banana chips, ceviche, sandwiches, and other food which his mother helps him prepare. He works from 8:00am until 1:00pm because he has to go to college. He has had this business for a year.

This loan will be used to buy juices, soft drinks, and supplies needed to prepare food. This is his third cycle with the credit group and he likes it because thanks to these loans he can succeed in his business which allows him to make a living. His dream is to have his college degree.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks, and supplies.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en: Phat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Tweimukye Kyamakabugo Group

texts.en:
Gorret aged 39 is a resident of Kagadi-Uganda, who trades in second hand clothes, operating in mobile markets and supplements her income with farming. Gorret is single mother of 4 and very hardworking who started her business in 2008 in order to earn a living. However she is faced with the problem of little working capital.

She is therefore going to use the loan to buy clothes for resell. She is a member of Tweimukye Kyamakabugo group, where members have to guarantee one another in order to access a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resell

loans.name: Lantoniaina Charline

texts.fr:
41 ans, marié, Charline est mère de cinq enfants dont deux déjà mariés, et trois encore à sa charge et scolarisés dans une école privée (2,6 et 15 ans). Son mari est pompiste dans une station shell.
La broderie est son activité depuis très très longtemps 1991. Elle coude des draps, des couvres lits et des nappes et puis après les brode. C'est elle-même qui crée les dessins. Elle voudrait développer et améliorer cette activité. Son désire est de trouver des marchés à l'étranger à part ceux qu'elle a déjà localement. Avec le prêt, elle va pouvoir renouveler les stocks de tissus et des fils à broder.
texts.en: Charline, is 41 years old, married and mother to five children, two of whom are already married. The other three children are still in her care and studying at a private school; they are two, six and 15 years old respectively. Her husband is a gas station attendant in a Shell station. Charline has been carrying out an embroidery activity for a very long time, since 1991 in fact. She sews sheets, bedcovers and tablecloths, and then embroiders them. She creates the designs herself. She would like to build up and improve her business. Her wish is to find other markets abroad, apart from her local ones. With the loan she will be able to renew her stock of fabrics and her embroidery threads.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Voert's Group

texts.en:
Voert lives in a village of the Battambang province’s Sangke district. She is 45 years old and married with three children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school.

To make a living, Voert has been growing rice and soybean and raising cows for 10 years. The current business earns her about 50,000 KHR per day.

This is Voert's first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a repeat customer whose previous two loans were funded by Kiva. Thank you for your your generosity.

George is married and practices agriculture. He was able to buy cows using the previous loan; this helped him to increase his income base and is now able to sell milk. He is so appreciative of the great support that Kiva lenders have given him as he has been in position to finance his business and grow his income. He will use the loan to buy more dairy cattle so that he will be able to sell more milk which will boost his income.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cattle

loans.name: Oul's Group

texts.en:
Aged 52 years, Oul is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Kam Rieng district of Battambang province. She is a mother of twelve children, only two of whom are dependent on her and still in school.

Oul earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava, which she has been doing for 17 years. Her husband is a paid construction worker to help support the family. Together, she and her husband can earn about US $7 per day from the current business and are able to save about US $4 each day for the future.

This is the fourth loan for Oul with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Oul, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

This loan will enable her to extend her farmland so as to increase her rice farming production to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Hou's Group

texts.en:
Hou is originally from a village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district. She is 45 years old and married with three children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school.

For more than 15 years, Hou and her husband have been farming rice as a primary source of the family’s income to make a living. They can earn about KHR 50,000 per day and manage to save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Hou has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already, and she wisely and successfully used the first loan to make her living conditions better. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Hou will use her loan portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

This loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Harisoa Hilarie

texts.fr:
Harisoa Hilarie est une femme débrouillarde,courageuses et travailleuse de 43 ans.Elle est une mère de trois enfants  de 13, 17, 19 ans et qui sont tous scolarisés.Son mari travaille dans une entreprise de zone franche en tant qu'ouvrier donc son salaire est faible.
Auparavant, elle travaillait aussi dans une entreprise de zone franche, c'était dur alors que le salaire est faible , donc elle a démissionné en l'an 2000 et démarrait sa propre activité de commerce en détail des ustensiles de cuisines et des fournitures scolaires. Elle effectue des ventes ambulantes. Elle voudrait développer et étendre son activité. Le prêt va lui permettre de renouveler ses stocks de marchandises et renforcer son fonds de roulement.
Son souhait est que ses enfants réussissent dans leurs études et dans la vie en générale.
texts.en:
Harisoa Hilarie is a resourceful, courageous and hardworking woman who is 43 years old. She is mother to three children, who are 13, 17 and 19 years old respectively and are all at school. Her husband works as a laborer in a company in the tax-free zone, and his salary is therefore low.

Beforehand she also worked in a company in the tax-free zone, but it was hard because her salary was low, and so she resigned in the year 2000 and started up her own business retailing kitchen utensils and school equipment. She sells on a door-to-door basis. She would like to build up and expand her business and this loan will enable her to renew her stock and boost her working capital.

She would like to see her children succeed in their studies and in life in general.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and school equipment.

loans.name: Yoern

texts.en:
Yoern lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She is 44 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are still in school in the local area.

To support her big family, Yoern has been working as a rice farmer on four-hectare farmland for more than 20 years.

This is Yoern’s second loan with VisionFund. She is seeking a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

With this loan, she hopes to make more healthy rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's handbags, shoes and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies (fabric, thread, accessories) in order to increase production, have greater sales, and to generate better income for her son.

loans.name: Alfounce

texts.en:
Alfounce 45 years old. He is married, and has three children. 

His business is a retail shop. He has been in this business for 15 years. 

Alfounce earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his third loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy additional stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, maize flour, rice, detergents, etc. for his shop.

He will use the profits from the expanded business to educate his children as well as repay his loan. 

His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and complete his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of sugar, cooking oil, salt, maize flour, rice, detergents, etc. for his shop

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosana works hard to support her family.

She has a bread vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosana is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, yeast, margarine, sugar, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rosana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, yeast, margarine, sugar, etc. for her business

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetables vending business.

Severina has been in this business for 21 years. Severina earns more income from raising livestock.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Severina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernadita is 64 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy additional items to sell, like rice, canned goods, detergent soap, cooking oil, etcetera.

Bernadita has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and she also earns income from food vending. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like rice, canned goods, detergent soap, cooking oil, etcetera.

loans.name: Betty Linda

texts.en:
Betty Linda is a married woman who has nine children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Betty Linda is 53 years old, and three of her children are still in school.

Betty Linda has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use it to buy a greater variety of fish to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
A 63-year-old woman is living in a wooden house in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Lon is a mother of two children. Growing cassava and cashew are the main sources of her income for 7 years. Recently her crop was destroyed by insects, which is the problem for her farming business.

Lack of working capital causes her to apply for a new loan with VisionFund, which is the sixth loan for her. Through those past loans, she can afford to buy household supplies to be better support her living. She will manage this new loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to produce good outputs. On the other hand, she will take the remaining money to spend on renting farmland as well. She hopes to sell it for good income to support her family’s living and save for future need.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to produce good harvests, so that she can sell at a better price, in order to increase her income, to save for future neesd.

loans.name: Irish

texts.en:
Irish works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

Irish requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell.

She has been in this business for ten years now.

Irish would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Pheak

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Dambe district of Kampong Cham province, Pheak is 24 years old and married. She has one small kid.

The primary sources of her family’s income are from growing cassava and collecting recyclable cans to sell. Having been in this business for six years, she can earn about 76,000 KHR per day. She manages to save about 30,000 KHR each day after expenses.

Pheak has been a member of VisionFund for three cycles already, and she wisely and successfully used the past loans to improve her family’s livelihood and relieve financial burdens. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use some portion of it on labor fees.

She hopes to make more healthy rice and cassava so as to increase her family’s income to better her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Tusitukire Wamu Kyesiiga Group

texts.en:
This group is one of the most gifted with natural resources, but the most unlucky in resource allocation in terms of development in Rakai district. It has members who started this group to improve their members’ ability in sustainable development and to extend membership support to their rural set up and underserved members. This group is designed to meet the needs of low-income and illiterate members, especially agriculturalists who are in a unique position to look for funds to fund their innovative products and extend them to even more people in their area.

Edward is one of the group members who believe in creation of self-employment and generation of income through hard work to transform lives. He is looking for a loan facility to buy farm inputs in order to be able to add additional value to their group businesses to boost activities for good service delivery to their demanding customers. He describes himself as a hardworking man who encourages lenders to meet their interest.

loans.use: to boost farm yields by buying organic fertilizers and improved seeds.

loans.name: Phoern's Group

texts.en:
Phoern, 40, lives with her husband and three children in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Two of her children are still in school. She has struggled to feed and care for her children by farming rice on two-hectares of farmland. She has been in the business for 22 years while her husband is a paid worker in the local area. Together, they can earn about 37,000 KHR per day and manage to save about 20,000 KHR each day for the future.
Phoern has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She wisely and successfully used the loans from VisionFund to relieve her family’s financial burden and to buy some basic household necessities for the family. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for another loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to grow her rice healthily and earn more healthy crops to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Leandra

texts.es:
La señora Leandra nacio en 1988 en la localidad de Toropalca provincia Nor Chichas del departamento de Potosi. 
La señora Leandra  es madre de familia de 2 niños, esta concubinada con el señor Nelson, ella junto a su esposo se esfuerza día a día por darle mejores condiciones de vida, alimentación, salud y educación a sus hijos. Trabajando en diferentes actividades que le generen ingresos económicos, esto para tener ingresos estables y sostenibles en bien de su bienestar familiar, desde hace 2 años viene trabajando como ayudante de cocina, esta actividad le brinda ingresos económicos favorables para la sostenibilidad de su familia, la señora a adquirido habilidades en la actividad administrativa de sus ingresos económicos, y en vista de tiene una actividad de trabajo permanente, decide sacar un préstamo para adquirir una vivienda en anticretico para darle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia
texts.en: Leandra was born in 1988 in the town of Toropalca, province of Nor Chichas in the department of Potosi. She is the mother of 2 children and married to Nelson. Together with her husband, she strives every day to give her children better living conditions, food, health and education. She works in different jobs that get her an income. She does this to have a stable and sustainable income for the well-being of her family. 2 years ago she started working as a kitchen assistant. This job gives her a good income to support her family. She has acquired skills in administration of her income and is in sight of having a permanent job. She has decided to take out a loan to get a home with a loan to give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a family loan and begin to save money to improve her family's life.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is a married man with six children. He describes himself as polite. He operates a farm where he grows bananas, maize and other crops. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be crop pests and diseases. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable him to increase production. His business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Warisata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WARISATA” iniciará el trigésimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de muebles, venta de ropa deportiva, tienda de barrio, venta de canaletas, venta de medias, venta de sombreros, venta de ropa para niños, servicio de transporte. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa deportiva; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años por iniciativa propia, comenta también que el primer préstamo que solicito en la institución le ayudo a aumentar su mercadería. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa deportiva por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos. 
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud y las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.

En la foto no aparece el señor Manuel ya que, después del desembolso, tuvo que ir a su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
The A.C. "WARISATA" will begin its thirty-first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima.  It consists of eight members and is headed by a board of directors where Maria is the President. Businesses that members of the community association are part of vary and include: furniture sale, selling sportswear, neighborhood store, eavestrough sales, selling socks, selling hats, children's clothing sale, transport services.

The loan being requested will benefit small microentrepreneurs where Maria is a member.  She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for three years now, becoming a member through an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution. 

Today she has a business selling sports clothing.  She says that she started this business several years ago on her own initiative.  She also said that the first loan she requested to the institution helped her increase her merchandise.

The loan being requested now is to increase capital (to purchase sportswear wholesale) which she will buy from wholesalers in the city of El Alto, and then re-sale in her own retail space. 

This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family financially, since she is married and has three children.
 
When she is asked what it is that she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training and health area and the training offered by the institution.

In the photo Manuel does not appear because, after disbursement, he had to go to his selling stand.

loans.use: to purchase sportswear  wholesale

loans.name: Imelee

texts.en:
This is Imelee, aged 39, from Polomolok, South Cotabato, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a businessman, with whom she has three children. One of her children is studying in college. Although the majority of Filipinos, like Imelee's family, do not have any luxuries, they are happy and content as long as they are healthy and love prevails among them.

As her husband's salary is barely enough to raise a family, Imelee decided to run a general store to help her husband make a living. She sells dry and packaged food, beverages, and household items directly to consumers. She also retails rice to augment her income. She has been in this business for 17 years already and has established a good name in her community.

To help her continue the operations of her businesses, she is seeking a 50,000 PHP loan which she will use to pay for canned goods, snack items, toiletries, beverages, and sacks of rice. She trusts your good heart to support her in her livelihood. You can be an effective instrument to achieve her dream of having a big grocery store someday.

Imelee hopes to send all her children to college, because she believes that education is one of the best inheritance that she could bestow them. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for canned goods, snack items, toiletries, beverages, and sacks of rice

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en:
Casiana is a hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing, in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell for her ready-to-wear clothing business, like t-shirts, slippers, shoes, pants, blouses, etcetera. Casiana has been in this business for 11 years. She earns additional income from house rental.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to further build her business. Casiana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like t-shirts, slippers, shoes, pants, blouses, etcetera.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell to her customers for her buy and sell banana business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ma. Nenita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables and spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing. Ma. Nenita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more spices and vegetables to sell for her business.

Ma. Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Marietta requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

She has been in this business for two years now.

Marietta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe is 46 years old and married with three children. With her three children in school, Anafe works very hard to provide for them.

Anafe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as eggs, beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Anafe has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Anafe would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as eggs, beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and sell-fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for four years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Famille Lukogo Group

texts.fr: Gervais sollicite un deuxième crédit pour renforcer l'entretien de son champ et agrandir sa plantation. Il reconnaît les bienfaits du précédent crédit dans l'entretien du café et le paiement de la main d'œuvre lors de la récolte. Les revenus générés ont permis à Gervais de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants, leur alimentation et l'agrandissement de son activité agricole.
texts.en: Gervais is requesting a second loan to improve the care of his field and to expand his plantation. He recognizes the benefits of the previous loan in maintaining coffee plants and paying for labor at harvest time. The revenues generated have enabled Gervais to cover his children’s schooling costs and food and to expand his farming business.

loans.use: to maintain and to expand the coffee plantation

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
Leang, 56, is a married mother living with her four children in a rural village of the Sandan district of Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. She earns a living through rice farming and has been in this business for 20 years. She earns approximately 10,000 KHR per day and is able to save approximately 5,000 KHR each day after expenses for their future needs. Low crop yields destroyed from drought has been the main challenge for her business.
Leang has never been a member of VisionFund before. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that this loan will enable her to have a proper latrine to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family.

loans.name: Muong Phang 32 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tin, 30, is a Thai ethnic lady who has been married and is the mother of an 11-year-old girl and a 7-year-old boy. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her children in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a remote small village. Mrs. Tin and her husband work very hard for a living through agricultural production with several activities such as cultivating rice, breeding pigs, chicken and fish. Mrs. Tin is a very diligent woman with good experience in farming and has always tried to expand production. This is the second time she has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish and expand her fish farming. Her previous loan for investment in pig farming was successful, which encourages her to continue investing and increasing her production. She hopes that with the technical support of the agricultural workers of the Program, her investment will go well and help her reap a good profit.

Mrs. Tin dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a bright future for her children. In the picture, she stands as the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish and expand her fish farming production

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 58 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a rural community outside Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She makes and sells cakes in her community or at the market to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

She requested a loan to buy a new outdoor oven where she can make more cakes for her business.

She plans to use her profit to help cover her family's daily expenses and also to provide better living conditions for her family.

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: a loan of $8500 helps Jessie buy an outdoor oven for her bakery.

loans.name: Verotiana

texts.fr:
Verotiana est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde de 45 ans. Elle est mariée et a un enfant de 19 ans. Elle confectionne des shorts depuis 2010. Elle n'a suivi aucune formation en couture mais se débrouille toute seule.
Elle a  beaucoup de clients. Elle voudrait développer et étendre son activité, et le prêt va être un moyen lui permettant de réaliser, même en partie ce développement et extension. Elle souhaite trouver d'autres clients et d'autres marchés. C'est une femme très courageuse et combative.
texts.en:
Verotiana is a woman who works hard and is resourceful. She is 45, married, and has one child who is 19. She has been sewing shorts since 2010. She has not attended any courses in sewing but just manages on her own.

Verotiana has a lot of clients. She would like to develop and expand her business, and this loan will be a means for her to realize this development and expansion, even if only partially. She would like to find other clients and other markets. She is a very courageous woman--a fighter.

loans.use: to buy various colors of cloth to use for sewing athletic shorts.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Ii Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVO AMANECER II” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felisa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pan, venta de verduras, venta de polleras (faldas para cholitas), venta de chamarras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felisa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promoción masiva de la institución que realizaron en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de polleras (faldas para cholitas); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, por iniciativa propia, en la actualidad quien le ayuda en su negocio es su esposo.

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de polleras por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “NUEVO AMANECER II” communal bank is starting their sixth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Tejada regional office. It is made up of nine members lead by a board of directors with Felisa as President. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are various. Amongst them are: the sale of bread, selling vegetables, selling polleras (traditional skirts), the sale of jackets, selling food and a neighborhood store.

The loan that they are taking out will help all these micro-entrepreneurs, Felisa being one. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, during a massive promotion that the institution held in her area. At present she has a business selling polleras (traditional skirts). She said that she learned this business a number of years ago on her own initiative. Her husband is helping her with her business currently.

The loan she is taking out is to increase her capital (buying polleras wholesale) that she will acquire at the wholesalers of the city of El Alto and later sell in her commercial space. This method of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she lives in a common-law realtionship and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the training and the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy polleras (traditional skirts) wholesale.

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal desde hace mas de 10 años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulantes por las diferentes colonias, gracias a su trabajo es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones, cremas, shampoo, desodorantes etc. todo por mayor y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Maria is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her two children. She has been working selling personal use items for more than 10 years. Her business is located at her residence and she also sells itinerantly in various neighborhoods. Thanks to her work she is able to pay some of the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy perfume, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant, etc wholesale. Then she will be able to continue with her work to obtain greater income.

loans.use: to buy perfume, lotions, creams, shampoo, deodorant, etc wholesale.

loans.name: Janilyn

texts.en:
Janilyn is a single woman and 25 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Janilyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Janilyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Norma has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nida is 55 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Nida has a buy-and-sell clothes business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more clothes to sell such as shirts, pants, etc.

Nida has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell such as shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is married with children and she operates a retail shop She also does crop farming. She desires to have a bigger shop with time and is doing everything possible to reach her dream.

Salome wants to add food stuffs in her shop because they are easily sold and are more profitable. The biggest challenge is that she lacks enough capital to purchase enough stocks. She requests money to buy food stuffs like tomatoes, potatoes, beans among others for selling and thus increasing her income levels.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs like tomatoes, potatoes, beans among others for selling.

loans.name: Vath's Group

texts.en:
Vath is a 47-year-old mother of five dependent children, three daughters and two sons. She lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district. She is a rice farmer in the local area, and she supplements her family’s income by working for others for a fee. Vath has been in this business for 29 years. Low crop yields, when crops are destroyed by drought and insect pests, have been the main challenge for her business.

This is the first loan for Vath with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Nav's Group

texts.en:
Nav, 29, is a resident of a rural village in Kampong Cham province. She has three children, one of whom is in school. She has been involved for 11 years in rice farming and working as a laborer at a garment factory, to earn her living. The crop has been destroyed by insect pests, so she cannot earn good income as she did before.

Due to having not enough working capital, she decided to lead a group to apply for a Kiva loan, via VisionFund Cambodia. This is the first loan cycle for her. Her group is comprised of two members. She is planning to use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, to increase the productivity of her rice crop. She hopes this loan will help her to gain more yield and income, to stabilize her business and enable her to send her young kids to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to increase her rice yield and income, to enable her to send her kids to school.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Famille Baba Tazama Group

texts.fr: Dans le but de préparer la campagne agricole de septembre, Dieudonné sollicite un deuxième crédit. Il projette orienter la plupart de fonds qu'il aura à recevoir dans le paillage et l'acquisition  d'une nouvelle plantation de café. Le crédit précédent lui a permis de bien récolter son café et ainsi de payer sans difficulté les frais scolaires de ses enfants, leur alimentation, l'agrandissement de son activité et les soins médicaux. Il a pu également amorcer la préparation de la terre pour la plantation de café et la pépinière. Il note cependant qu'au cours du remboursement de la troisième tranche, il a connu une difficulté liée à un acheteur qui n'a pas honoré son paiement, heureusement qu'il l'a contourné cette difficulté en vendant un de ses porcs
texts.en:
With the aim of preparing for planting in September, Dieudonné is requesting a second loan. He plans to direct most of the funds he’ll receive to mulching and acquiring a new coffee plantation. The previous loan enabled him to harvest his coffee and thus to cover easily the costs of schooling, food, and medical care for his children and to expand his business. He was also able to begin preparing the ground for planting coffee and for a plant nursery.

He notes however that, in the course of paying back the third installment, he experienced difficulty with a buyer, who did not honor his bill; fortunately, he got around this difficulty by selling one of his pigs.

loans.use: to maintain and harvest a field of coffee

loans.name: Nan's Group

texts.en:
Nan is a 38-year-old mother of two children and earns a living through farming rice. She has been in this business for 15 years and her current business earns her about 12,000 KHR per day to feed the family. Drought is the main challenge for her to better support the family’s business.
Nan is the first cycled client with VisionFund. She is now leading her group to request a loan. As the leader, Nan wants to use her portion to buy materials for building a decent latrine. She hopes that this latrine will enable her family to have good health.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a decent latrine.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.fr: Clotilde remercie beaucoup de tout son cœur tous les emprunteurs Kiva qui l'ont prêté dernièrement. Avec le crédit, elle a pu acheter des sacs de riz,  différentes sortes de viandes et  de légumes. Elle a pu augmenter le nombre de plats vendus par jour et par conséquent le chiffre d'affaire journalier. Le problème, c'est qu'il y a environ un mois, elle a été cambriolé et a perdu de l'argent destiné au fonds de roulement. De ce fait, elle doit renouveler ses stocks et demande un autre crédit. Elle espère que vous allez encore l'aider et lui tendez les mains. C'est une femme très courageuse et travailleuse, en plus son mari travaille avec elle dans l'exercice de cette activité, ils s'entraident mutuellement pour le bien-être de leur famille.
texts.en:
Clotilde thanks all the Kiva lenders who recently loaned to her from the bottom of her heart. With the loan, she was able to buy sacks of rice and various sorts of meat and vegetables. She was able to increase the number of servings sold each day and thus her daily turnover.

Her problem is that about a month ago she was robbed and lost the money she used as working capital. For this reason, she has to replace her inventory and is asking for another loan. She hopes that you will help her again, stretching out your hand to her.

Clotilde is a courageous and very hard-working woman. Her husband works with her in the business. They help each other for the well-being of their family.

loans.use: big cooking pots, containers, cutlery, rice, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 56 years old and widowed with three children. With one of her children in school, Esmeralda works very hard to provide for them.

Esmeralda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like personal care products, rice, home care products, rice and other groceries.

Esmeralda has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, soap, coffee, juices, canned goods, noodles, rice and other groceries.

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like personal care products, rice, home care products, rice and other groceries.

loans.name: Gustavo Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un señor con 62 años de edad, soltero y sin hijos, desde niño se ha dedicado a realizar trabajos ocasionales de diferente actividades, ahora tiene un propósito y es el de montar su propio negocio, un restaurante en el Municipio de Sincelejo.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual realizará la compra de mesas, sillas y demás herramientas de trabajo que sean de su utilidad.
Su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, ya que esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su estado actual no es el mejor.
Sus deseos de salir adelante pese a su edad no disminuyen.
Con su ayuda este hombre invertirá en un mejor futuro para él, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a man of 62 years of age. He is single and has no children. He has done casual work in various businesses since he was a boy. Now he has a plan, and it is to set up his own business, a restaurant in the municipality of Sincelejo.

He is applying for a loan with which he will make the purchase of tables, chairs, and other work tools that will be useful for him.

His greatest desire is to improve the condition of his house, since it was built a long time ago and its present condition is not the best.

His desires to get ahead have not diminished in spite of his age.

With your help, this man will invest in a better future for himself. Step up and make a loan!

loans.use: to make the purchase of tables, chairs, and other work tools that will be useful to him

loans.name: Ralyn

texts.en:
Ralyn is 22 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ralyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Ralyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Davy

texts.en:
Davy, 28, lives with her family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and the other one is too young to attend school. She has earned an income to support her family’s living via cassava growing and rice cropping for ten years. Her cassava did not produce a good yield because it was destroyed by insects. She can earn about 9 USD per day income from her farm and she can save about 4 USD per day from her daily income.

For Davy, this is her second cycle with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loan completely. Her family’s business has improved via the previous loan and her child can go to study as well. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to put on her cassava farm. She will also spend a part of the loan to pay for plowing fees for her farmland to get a good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income from her business to upgrade her living conditions and support her child’s education in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide, and pay ploughing fees for her cassava farm.

loans.name: José Lazaro

texts.es:
José, de 45 años de edad, no estudio porque sus padres no tenían suficientes recursos económicos, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales 4 van a la escuela y el otro esta pequeño.

José, es un agricultor desde su niñez, pues su padre lo llevaba a trabajar y así lo aprendió, después el continuo trabajando de esa manera y ahora aparte de trabajar como agricultor trabaja en una ganadería de corralero y la distancia que el recorre para llegar a ese trabajo es de 2 kilómetros aproximadamente, él viaja en un pick-up y a él le ayuda su hijo mayor cuando no tiene clases. 

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar todos los insumos agrícolas que necesita como semillas de maíz y frijol, abono, fertilizantes, plaguicidas y para pagar mano de obra que le ayudara a sembrar.

José, sueña con tener una gran parcela de hortalizas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
José, age 45, didn’t go to school because his parents didn’t have sufficient financial resources.  He is in a relationship; his partner works around the home.  They have five children, four of whom are in school, while the other one is little.

José has been a farmer since childhood, because his father would take him to work.  In this way he learned.  After that, he continued with that type of work and now, besides working as a farmer, he also works as a ranch hand.  He travels about two kilometers to get to his job, traveling in a pickup truck.  His oldest son helps him when he doesn’t have school.

José needs this loan to buy all the agricultural supplies that he needs, such as corn and bean seed, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for the laborers who will help him to plant.

José dreams of having a big farm, raising vegetables and basic grains.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural supplies he needs, such as corn and bean seed, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
Hope group members have been through the through lots of challenges. They continue to work hard and manage their loans successfully. They have come to appreciate the beauty of using loans and repaying them well as a result of the sessions they've had.
Molly is the treasurer of the group which is now in its second cycle. She is doing exceptionally well in her business. During her first loan, she received ugx500,000 that she used and managed to expand her business tremendously to the point that she added a new range of products which includes shoes, hand bags and beauty products.


Owing to her resilient business and the previous loan she attained, she has managed to impressively improve her life both socially and financially. She managed to buy a plot of land and additionally taken her children to better schools. One of the group members bought a cow.
Members of Hope group continue to encourage and help each other in difficult times. Hope will use her loan to buy stock of new shoes for sell.

loans.use: to boost her business by buying more stock of shoes

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 51 year old woman, and the mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession, her husband sells fruit e.g. apples, bananas, grapes etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shahida's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit for reselling and to expand his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position her husband is not able to purchase fruit for his business. Therefore Shahida has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business,

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruit to help her husband expand his fruit selling business.

loans.name: Aimée Nadia

texts.fr:
32 ans, mariée, Aimée Nadia est mère de deux enfants de 8 et 11 ans. Ces enfants vont actuellement à l'école. Comme activité génératrice de revenu, elle exploite avec son mari un commerce en détail des chaussures à l'occasion. Elle a commencé à exercer cette activité en l'an 2000. 
Son objectif est de développer et étendre son affaire pour qu'elle puisse augmenter le revenu familial afin de pouvoir améliorer le niveau de vie de la famille et continuer à financer les études de ses enfants. C'est pourquoi, elle décide de demander un prêt chez CEFOR.
texts.en:
Aimée Nadia, aged 32, is married and the mother of two children, aged 8 and 11. These children are currently in school. To earn an income, she and her husband have a retail business selling secondhand shoes. She began this business in 2000.

Her goal is to develop and expand her business, so that she could increase the family’s income, thus to improve the family’s living conditions and to continue financing the children’s education. This is why she decided to ask for a loan from CEFOR.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for men and some balérines.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is not new to the Fresh Life franchise; he has successfully operated two toilets for over a year now. “This is not just a good business, but a venture that has transformed Kayaba community beyond our expectation,” beams Peter, whose neighborhood was famous for flying toilets along pathways. Today, Kayaba is cleaner and the Fresh Life movement has become a source of employment to many youths who have joined in.
As for Peter, joining this movement has helped him become a better provider for his household and he has been able to expand his retail shop business. On a daily basis Peter serves at least two hundred customers per toilet per day with early mornings and evenings his peak hours of business. During this time there are long queues at Peter’s premises and he is worried it might escalate to him losing customers who do not like the experience. He is therefore seeking to purchase an additional Fresh Life toilet, which he anticipates will be a solution towards providing better services to his community members.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life toilet.

loans.name: M. Qasim

texts.en:
M. Qasim is a 33-year-old energetic man. He owns a small manufacturing business, with a few lathe machine for manufacturing and renewal various spare parts, made to order. He employs some workers to operate the lathe machines and for manufacturing purpose.

In this way not only he is generating income for his own family as well as reducing unemployment. A few days ago one of his lathe machines went out of order, due to continuously working and immediately needed to be fixed. Because the workers are losing their daily wages, without the replacement of affected parts, it affects the whole mechanism of the lathe machine.

Its maintenance requires huge part of income but he is unable due to lack of availability of funds. This the reason M. Qasim has humbly requested to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can fix the lathe machine. This way he will be able to continue his business smoothly and workers can manufacture spare parts and can also generate daily wages.
M. Qasim hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for his family.

loans.use: to fix the lathe machine, so employees can operate it and can manufactures spare parts.

loans.name: Ankhbayar

texts.en:
Ankhbayar, 27 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a mobile phone repair workshop for 7 years. His wife stays at home, looking after their three small children.

The house his family lives in has been deteriorating over the years, and now needs urgent repairs. Therefore he is requesting a loan of 2,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned, releasing fewer pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to provide a warm and comfortable place for his family to live, and to burn less coal for heating.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.en:
Segundina is married and is a mother of four who operates a piggery business. For five years, she earned enough to support her family's needs and her children's education.

She joined GDMPC and she has gained access to microfinance services. She was able to repay her previous loan. She borrowed a loan to buy feeds for her piglets.

She plans to improve the shelter to use it for her piggery expansion. She wants to improve her business to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her medical treatments.

loans.name: Nery Antonio

texts.es: Nery de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, sus tres hijas y su sobrino, el se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 20 años y gracias a us trabajo es como el ha podido salir adelante con los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa para damas por mayor y continuar con sus ventas ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: 33-year-old Nery lives in his own home with his mother, his three daughters and his nephew. He has been selling clothes for 20 years. Thanks to this occupation, he has been able to cover his household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy women's clothes in bulk and continue his sales, as this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una de las muchas personas que con el apoyo de los inversionistas de kiva sus vidas sean visto muy beneficiados, Rosa gracias a su préstamo pudo comprar  sus mercaderías para su tienda de abarrotes y a sus clientes pudo satisfacer mejor, con ello pudo mejorar sus ingresos, pero con este avance Rosa se siente muy contenta pero no conforme porque nuevamente se le presenta la necesidad de realizar la graduación de su hijo que en este año culmina sus estudios pero lamentablemente no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para cubrir esta necesidad es por ello que solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo en sus gastos de la gradación de su hijo. Ella estará realizando sus pagos con las ganancias que provienen de su tienda de abarrotes.
Su mayor  anhelo es que su tienda siga creciendo para mejorar sus ingresos y sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Rosa is one of the many people that has seen their lives benefited by the support of Kiva lenders. Thanks to her loan, she could buy merchandise for her convenience store, satisfy her customers and improve her income. She is very happy with this improvement but not fully satisfied, as she once again needs extra income due to her son's graduation. He is finishing his studies but she unfortunately does not have the resources to cover the expenses. This is why Rosa is requesting a loan to cover the costs of her son's graduation. She will make the repayments with the profits from her convenience store. Her biggest dream is for her store to continue growing so she can improve her income and living conditions.

loans.use: to cover her son's graduation costs.

loans.name: Mousumi

texts.en:
Mousumi is a 27-year-old woman who stays in a small village in Falakata of Alipurduar district, West Bengal. She lives with her husband and one son. Her son reads in preschool. Mousumi takes care of her family as well as engaging in her animal husbandry. Her husband is engaged in jewelry work.

Mousumi rears cows and sells milk to the villagers. Her husband’s income is quite inadequate for the family, so she started her small milk-selling business to provide financial support to her family. Because of growing expenses, it has become necessary for her to increase her income. She now wants to expand her business by buying a new dairy cow. So, Mousumi seeks a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

She will use the loan money to buy a dairy cow and its fodder. She is very hopeful that this investment will support her to earn some extra income and help her to save money for better education of her son and strengthen her family economy.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Nawung Biru Group

texts.en:
Sutarno, 48 years old, is the leader of Nawung Biru Farmer Group. They are standing in front of a cow house. Sutarno has a family with two children and lives in a small village in Bantul, Jogjakarta, Indonesia.

Sutarno strives to improve his family's economic conditions. He has a few cows to fatten and resell, and also runs the rice farming business. His business is going quite well. However, he was deeply concerned to see the high price and scarcity of non-renewable cooking gas, and also was seeing that the cow dung was wasted without further processing, which pollutes the air with a pungent odor.

After informed by Yayasan Rumah Energi (YRE) and CV. Bina Energy Mandiri Persada (a local business enterprise – biogas construction partner of YRE) about the Household Biogas (BIRU) Program, Sutarno saw that biogas is the best solution for his problem. He saw an opportunity to reduce his dependence on non-renewable cooking gas and chemical fertilizers. He become more confident after he heard the testimony of members of Nawung Sari Group, which is also a Kiva borrower group.

In order to make it happen, Sutarno invited four of his farmer friends to establish a farmer group. He is so keen to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and the other farmer group members to make it possible.

Sutarno has optimism that if he can build a bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and the bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizer for his plantation. He hopes that in the future, he also can invite all the farmers in his village to use biogas and assist his village to become an energy and food self-sufficient village.

loans.use: to build a bio-digester facility and utilize the biogas residue as organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Chhorvorn

texts.en:
Chhorvorn is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the Northwest of Cambodia. She is 27 years old.Her family owns three hectares of rice fields and 0.5 hectare of cassava field. In 2012 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Chhorvorn makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field and to repair her house.
Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. 
Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional handwoven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María vive en Olanchito, Honduras, tiene 39 años y junto a su esposo ha trabajado  la agricultura de granos básicos por más de 15 años con lo cual han logrado el sustento de su familia. Ella tiene  como objetivo  en un futuro establecer un negocio de  pulpería donde pueda vender productos básicos de consumo y darles a sus hijos una buena educación. Sus hijos que están estudiando a veces tienen dificultades por la falta de iluminación ya que donde viven no hay acceso a energía eléctrica, es por esta razón que María solicita un préstamo a Soluz Honduras para adquirir un Kit de Lámparas solares y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida  para ella y su familia, además de que  esto les reduciría  el costo de comprar velas y lámparas a base de kerosén y poder evitar la contaminación que estas producen; asimismo ya no tendrían que caminar largas distancias para tener que cargar su teléfono celular y tener acceso a comunicación.
texts.en:
María lives in Olanchito, Honduras. She is 39 years old, and together with her husband, she has worked farming staple foods for more than 15 years. They have been able to support their family in this way. María's future goal is to establish a convenience store where she can sell basic needs and give her children a good education.

María's children are in school. They sometimes have a hard time because of the lack of light, since the area where they live does not have access to electricity.

That is why María is applying to Soluz Honduras for a loan to buy a Solar Lighting Kit. This would allow her and her family a better quality of life, in addition to reducing the cost of buying candles and kerosene lamps and being able to avoid the pollution that these produce. Also, they would no longer have to walk long distances to charge their cell phone and would have access to communication.

loans.use: to buy a Solar Lighting Kit to improve her family's quality of life and to have access to communication.

loans.name: Mamifetra Nanie

texts.fr: Mamifetra Nanie est marchande d'arachides crues et grillées depuis 2012. Auparavant elle effectue des cultures maraîchères (des différentes sortes de légumes) et riziculture, et c'est elle-même et son mari qui commercialise les productions. C'est une femme travailleuse et débrouillarde, elle est mère de quatre enfants de 1 an à 10 ans dont trois sont scolarisés actuellement. La priorité de Mamifetra Nanie en ce moment est la scolarisation de ses enfants et leur bien-être. Elle projette aussi de construire sa propre maison car la famille habite dans une maison patrimoniale non encore partagée entre tous les héritiers. Elle voudrait offrir à ses enfants une meilleure qualité de vie, le plus confortable qu'elle peut.
texts.en:
Mamifetra Nanie is a small-scale merchant, selling raw and roasted peanuts since 2012. Before that, she did market gardening (growing various sorts of vegetables) and grew rice, and she and her husband sold their own produce. She is a hardworking and resourceful woman, the mother of four children from one to 10 years of age. Three of them are presently in school.

Mamifetra's priority for the moment is keeping her children in school and allowing them to thrive. She is also planning to build her own house since the family live in a house inherited from their ancestors, but which has not yet been divided among the heirs. Mamifetra would like to give her children a better quality of life, as comfortable as she can manage.

loans.use: to buy 270 kg of peanuts.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua-San Salvador Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Salvador, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Laureana, la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones personales entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
  La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, arroz entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the "SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA-SAN SALVADOR" community bank. This bank is located in the district of San Salvador, belonging to the Calca province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Laureana, who continues to run her grocery store business. She is a responsible and diligent person. She continues to sell convenience store items such as rice, sugar, milk and oil, among other things. She has had her business for a good while, and it brings her personal satisfaction and other compensation as well, since this is how Laureana gets her family ahead.

Laureana is applying for the loan to buy milk, rice, and other things.

In general, the members are grateful to whomever forms part of this dream, and they are committed to making their payments on time.

The person whose face is covered does not belong to the community bank. The members who are in the inset photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of their jobs.

loans.use: to buy milk, rice, and other things.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es: La señora Valentina tiene 44 años de edad vive actualmente en domicilio propio, tiene su esposo esta actualmente en el país de Argentina, tienen dos hijos que depende de ella de las cuales se encuentra estudiando en el nivel secundario. Su principal actividad de la cliente es el cultivo de papa, hace trabajar con ayudantes en la producción agrícola para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, ropa y servicios básicos y otros gastos que incurren en su diario vivir. Es por eso que la señora Valentina requiere el préstamo que será destinada para la compra insumos y preparación de terreno agrícola para siembra de papa. Con la compra de la misma la señora Valentina podrá realizar la siembra de 3 hectáreas de papa y así podrá obtener y aumentar sus ingresos económicos para mantener su hogar y mejorar sus condiciones de vida con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Valentina is forty-four years old and currently lives in her own home. She has a spouse who is currently in Argentina. She has two dependent children who are studying in secondary school. Her main employment is growing potatoes. She works in agricultural production with other workers in order to cover the costs of food, clothing, basic services, and other costs that they incur in their daily lives.

That’s why Mrs. Valentina needs a loan which will be set aside for buying raw materials to prepare farmland to grow potatoes. With the purchase, Mrs. Valentina will be able to sow three hectares of potato plants. She will be able to increase her income and use it to keep her home and improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to prepare farmland for potato planting and to increase production and her family's income level

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 55 years old and married with two children. Flora works very hard to provide for them.

Flora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, junk food, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Flora has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Flora would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, canned goods, junk food, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea is 51 years old, married with seven children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Timotea has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Armenda

texts.en:
Armenda works hard to support her family. Armenda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Armenda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Armenda has been in this business for 35 years now.

Armenda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 59 years old and married with five children. Anecita works very hard to provide for them.

Anecita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

Anecita has been in this business for 2 years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida works hard to support her family. Adelaida is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Adelaida requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Adelaida has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional variety of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy flowers to sell.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cherry works hard to support her family.

She has a multicab transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Cherry is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her multicab transport business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
