Helen is a 51-year-old member of CCT General Trias branch. She is married to Roberto, a jeepney driver and has three children of whom one is in college and the other two are already working. Education is of primary importance to Filipinos to uplift their lives so the couple do their best to give their children a college education.

Helen operates the jeepney which her husband drives. Jeepneys are a unique public transportation found only in the Philippines. They are originally an American military service vehicle used during World War 2 and have been converted into a transportation vehicle by making them two meters longer and putting two long upholstered seats in them. Since then it has become the most common and cheapest form of public transportation. Aside from her jeepney she also has a boarding house for rent.

She hopes she could borrow funds in the amount of 30,000 PHP to pay for the transmission and maintenance of her jeepney. A regular and proper maintenance of her vehicle is necessary to ensure efficient performance and steady income. Part of the loan she will also use for the renovation of her boarding house to attract more boarders. She trusts you could consider her request to sustain her livelihood thus fund her child's education and pay the monthly loan of their house.

Helen hopes to acquire a new jeepney and expand her boarding house. She also prays for abundance in their lives. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God that she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the transmission and maintenance of her jeepney and partly for the renovation her boarding house.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 56 years old and is married with two children, both of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, snack food, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Vilma has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of other items, such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.  In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, snack food, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes is 49 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Ma. Lourdes is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines.  Ma. Lourdes requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for 2 years now, and she has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.  In the future, Ma. Lourdes would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 30 years old and single, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Naomi runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home-care products, and beverages. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, and soap.

In the future, Naomi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home-care products, and beverages.

loans.name: Solohanitra Maminiaina

texts.fr:
40 ans, mariée, Solohanitra est mère de trois enfants de 5,9 et 15 ans. Ces derniers sont tous scolarisés actuellement. Son mari est tôlier-peintre.
Solohanitra vend des friperies, des appareils électro-ménagers  et des meubles d'occasion depuis 2000. Elle voudrait développer et étendre son activité , c'est pourquoi elle demande un crédit, elle voudrait augmenter les quantités  et les types des marchandises à proposer.
La famille a déjà sa propre petite maison  et elle voudrait faire de l'extension, en plus, elle doit héberger et nourrir ses vieux parents qui n'ont plus de source de revenu et ne peuvent plus travailler.
texts.en:
Solohanitra, aged 40, is the mother of three children, aged 5, 9, and 15, who are currently all in school. Her husband is a roofer-painter.

Solohanitra has been selling secondhand clothing, home appliances, and used furniture since 2000. She would like to develop and expand her business. This is why she is asking for a loan. She would like to increase the quantities and types of merchandise she offers.

The family already has its own small house. Solohanitra would like to add on to it. Plus, she must house and feed her elderly parents, who no longer have an income and can no longer work.

loans.use: to purchase bales of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a 37-year-old married mother of three children, who has been working as a Tupperware and beauty cosmetics sales person for three years.
Helen is a hard working lady, who puts so much effort to support her husband in increasing their income and developing their family's living.
Her business income is just good enough to cover their family's daily living needs.

So, an acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will help her a lot in paying for her children's increasing school tuition fees.

She hopes that in the future she can make sure to develop and expand her business, so she can provide her children with the best university degrees.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 60 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Evelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 42 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients and items like eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Liezel has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and items like eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Cyryl

texts.en:
Cyryl is 28 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children are presently in school.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Cyryl requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cyryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 45 years old and married with two children, with one child still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

Annalyn has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future She would like to save money to provide for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care product, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 55 years old and is married with one child.  She works very hard to provide for her family.  Clemencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles, and other snack foods.

Clemencia has been in this business for 20 years, and she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 56 years old and married with five children. One child is still in school. Cristina works very hard to provide for her family.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and snack foods.

Cristina has been in this business for one year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and snack foods.

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en:
Lauben is well known businessman mainly dealing in transport. He started this project in 2009 and he has managed to sustain his family. He has a wife and two children. He also deals in coffee farming as another source of income to support his family. Mr. Lauben is aged 29 years old. His children are aged 10 and 6 years old respectively. All of them are in school.

He has applied for a loan of UGX1,500,000 to buy fertilizers/mulches for manuring his coffee shamber to increase the yields and family sustainability. He is an honest man at work, on his business and he works for 10 hours a day. He sells to coffee factories around Bushenyi District. He is faced with the challenge of competition that affects the harvest. His vision is to buy a car.

Pictured is Lauben and wife in their banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana  is a 26-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring to help run her household activities. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to boost her earnings and wishes to spend it on providing a quality life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching up more dresses on time to boost her earnings.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 63 and the mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 10 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Razia buys materials such as Hand-Embroidery kits, ribbon, needles and embroidery machines from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers.

She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in embroidery business. So, Razia demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Razia will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials to sell in the market.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Financial constraints and the desire for a better life and good-quality education for her four children are only a few valuable factors that encouraged Azra to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf Foundation.

Azra is 46 years old; she is a married woman. In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income.

Azra needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en: Walaa is a 28 year old married woman living with her husband and three school aged children. In 2009, she decided to open a mobile shop and rechargeable cards. With her requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., she will increase her merchandise selection of new mobile phones and accessories with the intention of increasing her sales and therefore, her income.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise selection of new mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a single woman and she is 34 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Ligaya requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other supplies to use in her business.

She has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Ligaya would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies to use in her business

loans.name: Epie

texts.en:
Epie is 26 years old and single with three children, who are all in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

Epie has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 41 year old Palestinian plumber. He lives with his wife and three sons in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. His wife is unemployed, his eldest son just graduated from school and the remaining two still go to high school. Omar's income is currently the family's only source of income, which pushes him to work hard in order to increase his income every month.

Omar has been working as a plumber inside the camp for several years. He works in houses, offices and private businesses and his clients see him as an honest and reliable man.

He is asking for a 2,057,996 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa to buy new plumbing equipment and more specifically an air compressor. This new tool will expose him to new work opportunities by allowing him to service a larger area of the camp which will directly impact his household's income in a positive way.

loans.use: to buy plumbing equipment

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 36 and the mother of six children, living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her home embroidery business 6 years ago, because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Parveen buys materials such as Hand-Embroidery kit, ribbons, needles and Embroidery Machine from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers.

She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in embroidery business. Parveen has asked for a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.
Parveen will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for her to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 57 years old divorced woman, who lives alone in a small village called Ghvankiti. She has a small agricultural activity, cultivates land and harvests maize seasonally. Julieta lives under poverty as having no source of stable and significant income. According to above mentioned situation, she lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience.

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Julieta to get a loan of 800 GEL and start dairy farming. She will purchase a cow and start selling milk-products at the local market. Her costumers will be neighbors and people through the village. Julieta is very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to make better living condition. She is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving the chance to generate stable income.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start dairy farming.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana  is 46 years old, married and a mother of 5 children; shown in the photo with her husband. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. Rehana  aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she owns.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Sariaka Nantenaina

texts.fr:
20 ans, mère célibataire, Sariaka est une jeune femme débrouillarde consciencieuse et travailleuse. Elle éleve seule son enfant qui a maintenant trois ans. Elle et son enfant habitent avec sa mère en ce moment.
Elle dirige un commerce de fruits et légumes et du riz il y a maintenant 2 ans, le magasin appartenait à sa mère, et  quand cette dernière a trouvé du travail au bureau, elle lui a laissé la gérance du commerce mais elle reste quand -même associée.
L'objectif de Sariaka est d'être indépendante et autonome vis à vis de sa mère, elle voudrait vivre seule avec son enfant dans sa propre maison et avoir son propre affaire sans s'associer avec personne.
texts.en:
Sariaka, aged 20, is a young unmarried mother who is a hard-working and conscientious problem-solver. She is alone raising her child, who is now 3 years old. She and her child live with her mother at this time.

Sariaka has been running a business involving fruit & vegetables and rice for two years. The store used to belong to her mother, who found work in an office and then let her daughter manage the store while still remaining an associate.

Sariaka’s goal is to be independent and autonomous with regard to her mother. She would like to live by herself with her child in a house of her own and to have her own business without any associates.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables: beans, corn, tomatoes, potatoes, carrots, onions, and different types of rice, etc.

loans.name: Rustico

texts.en:
Rustico is married and has 2 children. He is 53 years old and lives in Mamanga Gamay, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Rustico used his previous loans for farm inputs and improvements. He is a successful farmer who works tirelessly to improve his family's living standards.

Rustico is now able to cultivate the adjacent farmland, but he needs money for manure fertilizer and labor costs. He recently took a loan and has made his plan a reality.

In the future Rustico hopes to be able to expand his business and continue improving the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his vegetable garden.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en: Malak is an 18 year old single woman living with her parents. Her father is the main income source in the family and as for her she is only focusing on her school. Today, with the aim to buy her books for the new school year. She said that she is very happy and her only target is to achieve her education suitably and being able to achieve higher levels and help her father with the expenses.

loans.use: to buy her books for the new school year

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is glad that the loans that were previously granted to her has helped increased her sales on her fruits and vegetables stand. They may not be rich but her family is happy and secured in their love for each other. 

She is again humbly asking for a 8000 PHP loan to buy ingredients such as fruits, vegetables and grocery items for her variety store. It will help sustain her business and thus fund their daily needs. She thanks KIVA and CCT for the continuous support on her livelihood.

She prays for God to prosper her in all areas of her life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies . 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional fruits, vegetables and grocery items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 57 years old now.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca fiber and other supplies needed in her business.

She has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies needed in her business

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and all her children are in school.

Ma. Cristina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Ma. Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Famille Joel Mugaru Group

texts.fr: Cela fait trois ans que Joel a hérité de son père un champ de café contenant deux cent cinquante tiges. Le revenu tiré de ce champ l'a aidé d'ouvrir un cafétéria et un salon de coiffure. Comme obstacle, la famille est souvent heurté à beaucoup de travaux lors de la récolte et est tenu à engager une main d'œuvre pour l'aider. Il projette acheter un autre champ de café. Il est sur photo avec son épouse Rébeka.
texts.en: Three years ago, Joel inherited his father’s field of coffee comprised of 250 stalks. The revenues earned from this field has helped him to open a cafeteria and a hair salon. As far as obstacles, the family is often impacted by a lot of work at harvest time and is anxious to hire laborers to help. He plans to buy another field of coffee. Joel is in the photo with his wife Rébeka.

loans.use: to pay laborers for mulching his field of coffee plants

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 54 years old and a mother of seven children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for 22 years ago to meet the family’s expenses.

Now Maryam’s husband wants to repair his auto rickshaw for proper transportation services, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to repair the auto rickshaw. Therefore Maryam has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Maryam’s husband can do the repairs and provide the proper transportation services to earn an income.

Maryam and her family will be thankful to the Kiva lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to repair the auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Augustine,

texts.en:
Augustine, is a married man, and a father of 4. He operates a shop with new clothes in a very busy market and also earns a monthly salary. His family is proud of him, for they don't lack anything, he being a very hardworking man who goes an extra mile for them.

With time Augustine plans to expand his shop and he is working so hard to achieve it. For now he has a need in his shop for traditional clothing for both women, and men. This will help to increase his stock and profits as well. He is requesting for money to buy traditional clothing called Kitenge for selling.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing for men and women called kitenge, for selling.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 45 year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of one daughter and two sons.

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a tailor and an expert in his profession. He has been sewing clothes for many years. This is the reason he has lot experience about his profession. His sewing machine has become out of order and needs to be replaced with new one but he does not have sufficient money to buy new machine.Therefore, Zainab requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new sewing machine.

Her family has to do hard work to get income for a huge family, her husbands also participates in the monthly income. Zainab wants to arrange a dowry for the marriage of her daughter, this is why she is saving most of the earnings.
Zainab is very thankful to the and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her husband's tailoring services.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 44 years old and has four children. Arlene is married and has three children who are in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Arlene has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Narcedes

texts.en:
Narcedes is 29 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Narcedes requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Narcedes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ma. Socorro

texts.en:
Ma. Socorro is 47 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, personal care products and other groceries.

In the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Floredelina

texts.en:
Floredelina is 67 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

She has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from dried fish vending.

Floredelina aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina own and manage her coconut farm for almost three years. She's planting coconut trees to sell in the market. She has been selling crops for over 3 years and has made favorable returns. She helps her husband as a farmer in making their coconut farm more productive.

Gina joined and gain access in GDMPC. She requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and to cover the costs of labor of the farm, to enhance the growth of crops and for a high potential of return on investment. In the future, Gina hopes to expand the cultivated area and raise more of these plants to gain more profit.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to cover the costs of labor of the farm

location.town: CALUYA, SAPANG AMA, SAPANG DALAGA, MISAMIS OCCIDEN

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Adela is 56 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Adela has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Adela requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional variety of fish to sell to her customers.

Adela has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Adela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Surrounded with a poor financial circumstances, she needed to start her own business for meeting her household expenditures financially. Suriya is 47 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for many years. She very well knows the techniques of sewing. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 45000 PKR to buy sewing materials such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy sewing material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 60 years old, widowed and has nine children.

Divina is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Divina requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Divina has been in this business for 7 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Divina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Claire Odile

texts.fr:
39 ans, mariée, Claire Odile est mère de quatre enfants de 1an à 15 ans,dont trois d'entre eux sont scolarisés. Elle vend des vêtements fripes depuis très longtemps. Elle commençait à exercer cette activité en 1999. Elle a pu construire sa propre maison et financer les études de ses enfants par le biais des économies qu'elle a pu faire à travers les bénéfices de cette activité.
Elle voudrait continuer à développer et étendre son affaire c'est pourquoi elle demande un crédit auprès de CEFOR. Son prochain projet est de faire une extension de sa maison qu'elle pourra louer pour augmenter son revenu.
texts.en:
Married and 39 years old, Claire Odile is the mother of four children ranging from one year to 15 years of age, of whom three are in school. Claire Odile has been selling used clothing for a long time. She began this business in 1999. She has managed to build her own house and pay for her children's studies using the savings she has been able to put aside thanks to the business.

Claire Odile would like to continue to develop and expand her business. That is why she is asking for a loan from CEFOR. Her next project is to build an extension on her house that she can rent out as to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy some bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia is 55 years old and married with two children. One of her children is in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk food, canned goods, home-care products, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Senia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, canned goods, home-care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sandhyamani

texts.en:
Sandhyamani is a 33-year-old married woman from a small village in Kandi, West Bengal. Being a dedicated housewife and a responsible mother, she is raising her only son who is a student of grade nine. She lives with her husband and son in the village of Radhabajar.

Sandhyamani's husband runs a cycle shop. Prior to his business, her husband was engaged in a cycle shop where he learned repair work. Taking those experiences, he has opened his own shop where he sells bicycles and bicycle parts (like chains, tires, brakes, valves etc.). He also repairs cycles. But due to a competitive market, there are many other shops nearby. So it becomes very difficult for them to run the business smoothly. Sandhyamani also assists her husband in his cycle shop after completing her household work.

To expand the business, Sandhyamani requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to decorate their shop with more modern bicycles and more spare parts to sell.

She hopes that she will be able to generate better profit from this business to improve the lifestyle of her family and provide further education to her son.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more new cycles and cycle spare parts for her husband's cycle shop.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en: It was hard for Zakia to manage her household expenses with the small income from her husband. Zakia is a 36-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 2 children. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. Zakia has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Rozeena

texts.en:
Rozeena is 42 years old, a married woman with 3 children. She is doing business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Now she has requested for a loan of 55000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Rozeena hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time

loans.name: Famille Kiroha Group

texts.fr: Ayant hérité un champ de café contenant quelques tiges avant son mariage, Daniel a ménagé beaucoup d'efforts pour en rajouter d'autres. Cette activité participe grandement à l'alimentation de sa famille et la scolarisation de ses enfants. Le seul obstacle qu'il heurte présentement est le manque des outils aratoires. Il souhaite améliorer sa production et par conséquent sa vie familiale. Il pose sur photo avec son épouse.
texts.en:
Having inherited a coffee field with several plants before his marriage, Daniel has put a lot of effort into adding other plants. This activity goes a long way toward expenses of feeding his family and putting his children in school. The only obstacle he is presently encountering is the lack of tools for tillage.

Daniel would like to improve his production and in that way his family's life. He has posed for the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to maintain his coffee field.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en:
Gelyn is 42 years old and married with six children. Three of them are still in school and she works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Gelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN, la socia sigue con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia sigue vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the San Valentin communal bank. She continues to work selling clothing, which she has done for a while. Her business is going well thanks to the effort that she puts forth every day. She continues to sell her merchandise to the customers who seek her out.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time. She hopes to continue working this way so that she can continue to support her family.

She will purchase blazers and other things.

loans.use: to purchase blazers and other things.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN VALENTIN,la socia continua con el negocio de venta de ropa a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia sigue vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the San Valentin communal bank. She continues to work selling clothing to her customers. She still sells merchandise to the customers that request it. She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

She hopes to continue working so that she can keep supporting her family. She will use the loan to purchase jackets and other things.

loans.use: to purchase jackets and other things.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 29 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Maricel has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

Maricel has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is 25 years old and a rural married woman who is a mother of two toddler sons. Purnima is a homemaker who studied up to the secondary level. Her husband is a farmer by profession, involved in agriculture. They live in a small village in Falakata named Baradoba in the district of Alipurduar.

Purnima works hard every day from early morning. She helps her husband in his agricultural activities. Her family's main activity and source of income is in the planting and cultivation of paddy rice. One of the challenges she and her husband come across in the maintenance and support of their crops is the high prices of the farm inputs.

Thus, she has applied for the loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, to purchase farm supplies like paddy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc. and to maintain the operational cost for farming. She hopes to get a better income from their business with this loan. Both Purnima and her husband want to give a proper education to their sons.

Her plans are to save a little more to purchase some farming land for them and she thanks her lenders very much for their help.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and manure and pay for the operational costs for growing paddy.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 34-year-old housewife from Falakata. She lives in the small village of Chuyakhola in Falakata, Alipurduar district with her husband and two daughters. Her daughters are students of different grades and Kalpana always tries to provide them with all sorts of educational help so that they can continue their studies smoothly.

Kalpana's husband has been engaged in a small business of selling sacks and gunny sacks for last two years. Her husband buys different kinds of gunny sacks from the wholesale market and sells them in the local market shops, but his meager income does not provide the family with a decent lifestyle and he is facing difficulties in covering all the family expenses. So Kalpana has decided to invest in her husband’s business in order to provide more for her family.

She knows that there is a great demand for sacks in the market. Despite the many challenges, the greatest of them she is facing is capital to expand the business. So she has asked for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase gunny sacks and sacks in bulk from the wholesale market so that she can increase her sale volume.

She hopes it will enable her to earn more income and build a secure lifestyle for her family. In the future, she has a long-cherished dream to construct a concrete house for her family with the outcome profit from her business.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase more gunny sacks and sacks for her husband's existing business.

loans.name: Auxilia

texts.en:
Auxilia is 46 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, eggs, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Auxilia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, juices, ketchup, candies, beauty products, eggs, biscuits and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, eggs, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Dúo Princesas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Princesas
Este dúo está formado por doña Maria Juana ella tiene 31 años de edad y se dedica a la agricultura en general desde ya hace varios años en parcelas ubicadas en San Mateo, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de semilla de ejote, arveja china, abono, y pita para sus cultivos, su mayor deseo es tener una buena cosecha en esta temporada para poder entregar un buen producto en cooperativa cuatro pinos de la localidad.
texts.en:
Dúo Princesas

Maria Juana is one of the members of this group. She is 31 years old and has been working in agriculture for some years. She works in plots of land located close to San Mateo.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds of green beans and Chinese peas, fertilizer, and pita fiber for her plantations.

Her biggest wish is to have a good harvest this season in order to be able to give the local cooperative Cuatro Pinos a good produce.

loans.use: to grow vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 40-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a tailor from her house since 1995.
Fatima is a hard working woman, who puts so much effort in to supporting her husband in covering their family's living expenses.
Unfortunately, her income combined with her husband's aren't enough to cover the increasing living needs.

Thus for this reason, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her children's school registration fees.
She hopes that one day in the future she can open her own clothes factory and develop her family's living.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school registration fees .

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is a 30 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child still attending school. Her husband is the main income source and works untiringly to satisfy the necessities of life and till now he earns a fair revenue. That’s why, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her child’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register him with the coming school year what makes her very satisfied.

loans.use: to pay her child’s educational fees

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is married and operates a fishing business with her husband to make a living. She is selling fish in their village. She has been in this field of business for five years. She earns really good profits and has been able to provide for her family.

Recently she borrowed a loan from GDMPC to buy new fishing nets used for fishing. In the future, the couple wants to own a stall in the market in town where they can sell their fish, which will result in a greater income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets used for fishing.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 51 years old and married with six children. One of her children is in school, Carmelita works very hard to provide for them.

Carmelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Carmelita has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, junk foods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and married, with two children who are currently in school. Gloria works very hard to provide for them.

Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles, and other snack foods.

Gloria has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Gloria would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 40 years old, married and has four children who are all enrolled in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old and married with four children.

Gloria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Gloria has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Gloria aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Malyn

texts.en:
Malyn is 36 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Malyn has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending. Malyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Shenaz

texts.en:
Shenaz is the age of 37, mother of five children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 8 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Shenaz buys materials such as Hand-Embroidery kits, ribbons, needles and Embroidery Machines from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers.
She has now decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. Shenaz demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.
Shenaz will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for her to sell in the market

loans.name: Hajran's Group

texts.en:
Hajran is 42-years old lady and mother of six children; she is very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and been using wooden planks, bamboos which has depreciated over time.

Now her husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboos. Therefore, Hajran requested a loan for her husband so that her husband can buy new wooden smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband would earn maximum profit with the help of this loan.

Hajran is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy new sheltering material such as wooden planks, bamboo for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Romina

texts.es:
Romina es una persona trabajadora que está ofreciendo sus servicios de auxiliar en una Empresa Privada en la ciudad de Asunción.
Con el sueldo que percibe cubre los gastos de estudios de su carrera de contabilidad, está poniendo este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de libros y pago de las cuotas de su carrera. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Romina is a hardworking person who works as an assistant for a private company in the city of Asunción.

With the salary she earns, she covers the cost of her Accounting studies. She is applying for this loan to use it to buy books, and to pay for the tuition fees.

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy books and pay the university tuition fees.

loans.name: Ma. Amie

texts.en: Ma. Amie  is a 47-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She is trying hard to provide their needs including food, health, clothing, and education. She is in the agriculture business growing and selling bananas with the support of her husband. Through this, she earns a good amount of income to support the household expenses. In order to grow her sales in the near future, she has requested a loan to buy organic fertilizer and pay for banana replanting costs. She expects this to boost her earnings and profits. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and pay for banana replanting costs

loans.name: Harbiye

texts.en: Harbiye is a 35-year-old Lebanese married woman of three children’s who has been working since 2010 in the agriculture sector. She likes her occupation so much and willing always to develop it. Her husband has his own business, and they cooperate together to collect enough money to be able to pay the heavy life expenses. Today, she is applying to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase seeds and plants for her business in order to improve it. She is very positive about her future and wishes to ameliorate her lifestyle.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and plants

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 45 years old, married, and has four children, one of whom is in school. Rosemarie is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus works hard to support her family. She is married with one child and has a cellphone repair business in the Philippines.

Venus has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy spare cellphone parts and accessories to resell.

Venus has been in this business for 2 years now, though she also earns additional income from rice retailing.

In the future, Venus would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare cellphone parts and accessories to resell.

loans.name: Samphan's Group

texts.en:
Samphan is 29-year-old and a farmer living in Sangke district of Battambang province and a married mother of three children. To make a living, she grows rice, fishes and works for others for a fee for 10 years. Her daily income is around 8USD per day and she can save about 5USD each day as well. Her rice has not grown well so she can get a lower yield.

Samphan has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles already and she repaid those loans completely. She can afford to buy school supplies for her children through her past loans. As a group leader of this new loan, she is going to buy a boat and fishing materials to catch more fishes. She hopes this sixth loan will help her to increase income so as to expand her current business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a boat and fishing materials, so as to catch more fish so that she can get a better return and expand her current business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various school supplies.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en:
Iram is a 37 years old, married woman. She is involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases varieties of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Iram has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR. She wants to buy greater varieties of cloth in different colors, for her business to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to get boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is 44-year-old lady and mother of four children. She is a very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years, using wooden planks and bamboo which have depreciated over time.

Now her husband is unable to continue his business without new wooden boards and bamboo. Therefore, Kousar requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new smooth wooden boards and bamboo to continue his business.

She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and that her husband will earn maximum profit with the help of this loan. Kousar is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering material.

loans.use: to buy new sheltering material such as wooden planks and bamboo for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Mrs Farida lives in Dampit, Malang Regency on Java Island in Indonesia, one of the most populous places in the world.

In Indonesia, you cannot drink from the tap and most people don't even have a tap. For that reason, most inhabitants of Indonesians boil the water before they drink it. Or, if they have they money, they buy bottled water. Mrs Farida heard of a new option for disinfecting water when the promotion crew from Nazava water filters held a safe water training in her vicinity Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs Farida, who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This is the first time Mrs Farida applies for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.

This loan will allow Mrs Farida to buy 30 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 150 people.

loans.use: to purchase 30 water filters to sell to her community members providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Joanna

texts.es:
Joanna es una persona que se esta esforzando mucho para poder cumplir sus metas de ser una profesional que ayude a las demás personas por medio de su profesión de enfermera, ella es muy sacrificada y luchadora, comenta que uso u anterior préstamo para poder usar en sus gastos de manutención.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para el pago de sus cuotas y también para la compra de una notebook que le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.Agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder estudiat.
texts.en:
Joanna is a person who fights hard to achieve her goal of becoming a professional that helps other people through her profession. She is a nurse, and a persistent and devoted woman. She says that she used the previous loan to cover her personal expenses.


Today, she is requesting a new loan to pay the tuition fees and to buy a laptop, which will be of great help to continue with her studies. She is grateful for this new opportunity she is receiving to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay the university tuition fees and buy a laptop.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace 23 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Julia is 36 years old. She is a single mother who lives in a house she owns together with five children. She has had a small store for 23 years, at home. She has many customers because of the good prices she offers. With what she earns, she manages to cover some of the home expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy more products in bulk, such as candies, beverages, cereals, coffee, soups, eggs, gelatin desserts, and sugar, in order to continue selling and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more products in bulk, such as candies, beverages, cereals, coffee, soups, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita has been engaged in dried fish vending for three years ago. She is 59 years old married woman with four grown children from Loon, Bohol. Her husband's occupation is a farmer. She needs adequate funds to sustain her livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of dried fish. With these, she could able to purchase more supplies and distribute it to her respective customers. Eventually, Enriquita is doing her very best to expand and try to invest any possible business ventures to improve the family's living condition and prosperous in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 65 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilia has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 61 years old and married with one child. She is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Rene has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Rene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lis's Group

texts.en: Lis’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Lis makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Famille Ndaye Group

texts.fr: Joseph a commencé à cultiver le café depuis son enfance jusqu'à l'âge scolaire suivant l'habitude observée dans son village. A son mariage, il a agrandi sa plantation jusqu'à deux hectares contenant aujourd'hui deux mille tiges. Vu l'étendue qu'il possède et la fréquence de sarclage (après chaque deux semaines), il est tenu à disposer d'assez de fonds pour engager une main d'œuvre salariée afin d'exécuter cette tâche ainsi que celle de paillage. Il souhaite dans un proche avenir avoir des moyens suffisants pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants, surtout pour l'ainé qui va bientôt commencer l'université et poursuivre la construction de sa maison. Il est accompagné sur photo par son épouse.
texts.en:
Joseph began farming coffee since he was a child until school-aged according to the practices of his village. When married, he expanded his plantation to two hectares, now comprised of 2,000 plants. Given the expanse he owns and the frequency of weeding (every two weeks), he is anxious to have enough funds to hire salaried workers to carry out this task, as well as mulching.

His wish in the near future is to afford his children’s schooling costs, especially for this oldest, who will soon start at the university level. Joseph also wishes to build a house. He appears in the photo accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: to pay workers for weeding and harvesting

loans.name: Jihane

texts.en:
Jihane is a 30-year-old, single Lebanese woman, living with her parents. In 2012 she started her own business by opening her shop for vending toys and housewares. She has special selling methods and provides a high quality of products, and she is also working in parallel as a private teacher. She is well known in her region with the special talents in her domain.

Today, she is demanding a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to increase her business merchandise, to meet the needs of her clients in order to increase her income. Jihane is very proud of her business growth, and she hopes to enlarge her shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise.

loans.name: Nasim

texts.en:
Nasim is a 22-year-old single Palestinian refugee, who lives in a Palestinian camp and works hard to develop his living. In November 2014, Nasim opened his current fruits and vegetables selling business, and he is working hard on developing it. His income is fine, but not good enough to increase his business capital with requested items.

Thus, through an acquired YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, Nasim will increase his business merchandise with special seasonal produce to increase his selling and develop his business.
He hopes to continue developing his business in a well managed way so that in the future he might start a wholesale trade.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special seasonal produce, to increase his selling and develop his business.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas and vegetables to earn a living. For more than six years, she was able to provide and support the needs of her family.

She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying farm chemicals. To improve the farm, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings. Cresencia aims to expand her farm to have a better income.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a 33-year-old woman from Estancia, Iloilo. She is married and has three children, ages 11, 9 and 6 years old.

Claire's husband is a fisherman while Claire helps her husband in this business. They have been doing this for 15 years. They work hard together to earn a living and to support their family.

Claire is asking for a loan to buy a fishing net, fishing rod and engine for their boat to improve their catch.

In the future, she wishes to improve their business to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fishing rod and engine for their boat.

loans.name: Virgelen

texts.en:
Virgelen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virgelen is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Virgelen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Virgelen requested a PHP 21000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Virgelen has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Virgelen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 48 years old and single. She earns a living from her oyster culture business in the Philippines. Milagros has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

She has doing her oyster culture for 15 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

loans.name: Mugoma Farmers' Group

texts.en:
Samuel a member of Mugoma Farmers is a 52 year old man with 4 children, living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns a retail shop and also does farming growing banana for commercial purpose plus owning a butcher shop that adds him more income.He is faced with challenges of delayed payments by customers that distorts growth of his profits and thus delayed growth. However, he has future prospects of expanding his retail shop to a wholesale shop and educate all his children to higher levels of learning.

Samuel has asked for a loan to add stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil,soap,salt and matches for sale. The extra four people in the photo are non borrowers who are still saving hoping to borrow in the next cycle.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, salt, cooking oil,soap,salt and match box for sell.

loans.name: Maria Crsitina

texts.en:
She hails in the town of Loon, Bohol. Maria Cristina a a hard working mother with four children ages 10-20 year old respectively. She is earns a living by selling street food like fish ball and tempura(is a dish of seafood or vegetables that have been battered and deep fried). 
During night time, she also sold chicken and meat barbecue as supplemental income.


She has requested a loan in the amount of 6,000 PHP to purchase supplies for meat, chicken, tempura, and fish ball. With these, she could boost her earnings and able to prepare nutritious meals to the whole family.
She could now able to settle her obligation and handle her finances wisely.

In the future, Maria Cristina is determined that these will help improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for meat, chicken, tempura, and fish ball

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a sari-sari (variety) store owner. She lives in the town of Estancia in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has three children, ages 20, 19 and 17 years old. Her husband provides for the needs of their family through fishing.

Gina wishes to be a good mother to her children, providing them with a good eduction, and a good wife to her husband by earning income. Thus, she is asking for a loan to help her improve her sari-sari business and enhance their fishing business.

She plans to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, powdered milk, coffee, chips, biscuits, chocolate bars, candies, bread, powdered juice and soft drinks. She also will use the money to buy new engine for their fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, spices, toiletries, sugar, powdered milk, coffee, chips, biscuits, candies, bread, powdered juice and soft drinks for her store and an engine for her husband's fishing boat.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita is 55 years old, married and has four children. She is raising hogs for income. She hopes to keep ensuring good growth and nutrition to hogs that is why she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy feed for hogs sustenance. This will help maintain healthy hogs and sell them at higher cost someday.

loans.use: to buy feed for hogs sustenance

loans.name: Clarice

texts.en:
Clarice is a hard working mother lives in the town of Loon, Bohol. She is 23 years old married woman with one-year old dependent.
She is a dealer of Avon products like lotion, whitening soap, deodorant, and ready-to-wear apparel. In addition to that, she also sold electronic load to the locals where she lives.

She is asking for a loan to purchase Avon products like lotion, body spray, ladies apparel and purchase e-load. With these, it could help Clarice enhance her income and provide more supplies to continue to serve her respective customers.

She is hoping that she could expand her both sources of income to improve the family's living condition and established other sources of livelihood to be productive.

loans.use: to purchase Avon products like lotion, body spray, ladies apparel and purchase e-load.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Maria has a general store business in the Philippines. Maria requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store and earns additional income from frozen foods vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maria has been in this business for 22 years. Maria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 47 years old and has 3 children. She is married, and 2 of her children are currently in school.

Adela is in the agriculture business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase feed and other supplies to help raise her livestock.

Adela has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF in order to sustain it.

In the future, Adela would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to help raise her livestock.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 54 years old and married with nine children.

She is in agricultural business, farming vegetable in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

Wilma has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is 27-year-old housewife who lives in Multan, Pakistan and is the mother of three children.

Her brother, the only wage-earning person in the family, delivers luggage, grass, and water by using a rented donkey cart. He values the donkey cart more than any other thing, because it can make money for him to support his family.

He needs capital to buy a donkey cart of his own. However, due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult to buy one. Therefore, his sister Fozia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her brother. With the profits, they will be able to have some savings. Fozia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a donkey cart for her brother.

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is 45 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

Lisa has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending. Lisa aspires to save money to provide and secure for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy item to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles and other snack foods.

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Mrs Siti lives in Turen, Malang Regency on Java Island in Indonesia one of the most populous places in the world.

In Indonesia, you cannot drink from the tap and most people don't even have a tap. Therefore, most Indonesians depend on purchasing or boiling water. At a community gathering, where the outreach team from Nazava was invited, Mrs Siti learnt about an easier and better way of getting safe drinking water. Nazava Water Filters filter well, rain, and city water so it becomes safe to drink without boiling, without using fuel or electricity.

Mrs Siti, who fulfills a leading function in her neighborhood, seized the opportunity and became the sales representative of Nazava in her area. This is the first time Mrs Siti applies for a loan. She has an excellent record in repaying her loans.
This loan will allow Mrs Siti to buy 20 filters and sell them on consignment to her community making safe drinking water available to 100 people.

loans.use: to purchase 20 water purifiers to sell to her community members providing them with safe drinking water.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 8 y 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ área caracterizada por acoger a los damnificados de la inundación del rio años atrás, hoy en constante crecimiento.
Esther es morena, de baja estatura y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que trabaja como chofer y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de comida como el sabor de las tradicionales k'jaras, plato comprendido de cuerillo de cerdo a las brasas que lleva como guarnición maíz hervido, quesillo y ensaladas, “las k'jaras ya son una tradición tanto del campo como de la ciudad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una heladera para mantener los alimentos frescos. Su sueño es tener un restaurante grande, ella desea comprar una heladera para mantener los alimentos refrigerados y en buen estado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Esther solicita un préstamo para comprar una heladera para mantener los alimentos refrigerados y en buen estado.
texts.en:
Esther is a 34 year-old woman who lives with her partner and has three children who are five, eight and ten years old. Her business is selling food. She is a good mother, and is very persevering and responsible. Her business is done in the "Plan 3000" district, an area which is constantly growing and is known for welcoming flood victims when a river overflowed years ago .
