Esther is brunette, tall, and has a slim physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. She lives life alongisde her partner, who works as a driver, and their children who go to school. They live in a home built of brick that has all the basic amenities. 

Her business is selling food, such as the traditional "k'jaras", a dish of chargrilled pork topped with boiled corn, cheese and salad. She comments that the k'jaras dish is a tradition in both the countryside and the city. The advantage of her business is that she makes sales daily. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a refrigerator to keep the food fresh. 

Her dream is to have a large restaurant. She wants to buy a fridge to keep her food chilled and in good condition. This is first sequence of loans with the institution in two years performing this activity. It is for those reasons that Esther is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator to keep her food chilled and in good condition.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to keep her food chilled and in good condition.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela is a 35-year-old married mother of two children living with her family in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn income. She started her embroidery business 10 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Aneela buys materials such as a hand-embroidery kit, ribbon, needles and an embroidery machine from the market. A retailer handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market without a third party, so that she can earn a better profit for her family.

Aneela has become an expert in the embroidery business. Aneela has requested a loan to buy embroidery materials from the market.

Aneela is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for her business.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 32-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children. Her husband represents the main income source of the family in order to enhance their quality of life.

Today, she hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay the first instalment of their school fees. She will be more than happy to see them graduating and achieving their master's degree.

In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering her children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay the first instalment her children's school fees

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina lives in Suai and is 32 years old. She has been running her general store business since 2012 with her own working capital of (USD) $300.

She is requesting a loan of (USD) $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional stock to keep in her store such as coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, water, soy, eggs, pens, notebooks and other things to sell.

Florentina also has a shop of second-hand clothes and sells restaurant food in her house. She wants to open a big store and restaurant in the future, so she is taking this loan to improve her management of her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, candles, salt, biscuits, noodles, cigarettes, water, soy, eggs, pens, notebooks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Reygie

texts.en:
Reygie is a 48-year-old man from Estancia, Iloilo who is engaged in the buying and selling of dried fish. He has been doing this for 20 years to earn a living.

He is asking for a loan to buy fresh fish to be processed into dried fish. He also buys additional dried fish from other vendors to sell on a retail basis. In the future, he wishes to improve this business for sustainability and to provide for the needs of his family.

Reygie is a married man and has five children; two of these children are school-aged children ages 16 and 11 years old.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and school supplies and pay for fence repair.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 49 years old and married with seven children. With three of her children in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as shampoo, dishwashing liquid, soap, juice, canned goods, diapers, and other groceries. 

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, eggs, and other groceries.

Rosalina has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, eggs, and other groceries

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a  35-year-old married woman with four children. Three of her children are currently in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur who does business selling soft drinks in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of soft drinks to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is a woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Eufemia is 59 years old and has one child in school.

Eufemia has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a variety of dried fish to sell.

Eufemia has been in this business for six years. In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Sida Group

texts.en:
Sida is 43 years old. She is married woman with six children who resides in the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. She has five children who attend school and another one works as a factory worker. Sida and her husband have been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than twenty years. Both of them can earn approximately $8 per day.

Sida is pictured 1st from left, as group leader, would like to request a loan as part of a group of four members and she will use her portion to buy fodder for her ducks, to earn more income as well as her family’s living standard. In the future, she is going to buy more ducks to fatten and support her children to earn higher education.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her ducks

loans.name: Samut

texts.en:
Being a farmer, Samut, who is a 29-year-old single man, can only make $5 USD per day to support his family. Samut resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in the farming sector for nearly 10 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Samut would like to get a low-interest loan from Kiva in order to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan since it will promote his health, environment, and living standards.

He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like him.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Oula

texts.en:
Oula is a 24-year-old married woman living with her husband, with no children. She cooperates with her husband, who is the main income provider, and works together with him to fulfill their needs and they are able to live a respectful life.

She has four years of experience working as a hairdresser and beautician, where she greets her customers with a great smile. Today, she wants to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to purchase hairdressing and beauty tools. She feels that she was meant to work in this kind of business and states that she is very happy.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing and beauty tools

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma and her family lives in a town of Carles in Iloilo, Philippines. She and her husband are engaged in fishing business to earn a living. They have been doing this for six years. They work hard to provide the needs of their children, especially to give them good education.

Vilma is a 44-year-old woman and a mother of six children. Her oldest child is 21 years old while the youngest child is four years old. She wishes to uplift their livelihood to enhance their means of living. She is asking a loan to buy fishing net.

loans.use: to buy fishing net

loans.name: Celma

texts.en:
Celma is a 60-year-old married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She is married and has six children.

Her husband works hard as a farmer while Celma is running a sari-sari store business to earn a living.

She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as biscuits, chips, candies, bread, spices, noodles, canned goods, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, and chocolate drink.

In the future, she wishes to start other business opportunities to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, chips, candies, bread, spices, noodles, canned goods, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, and chocolate drink.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Antonia is 60 years old now.

Antonia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Antonia requested a PHP 11500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, oil, etc..

Antonia has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Antonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena has been involved in activities since 2000. She started her business with her own working capital of $50.00. Her husband is agriculture. So she is requesting a loan of $1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies according to people like, including candles, eggs,  noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, nuts,coffee, children's milk and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. She hopes to make her business bigger in the future.

loans.use: to buy candles, eggs,  noodles, cooking oils, detergents, biscuits, nuts, coffee, children's milk and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy continua con sus estudios, comenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas es por ello que se esfuerza mucho para poder ser alguien en la vida y crecer para ser una profesional reconocida. Ella en su anterior préstamo pudo pagar sus clases, lo cual le fue de mucha ayudan en sus estudios.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma continuar luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Nancy continues with her studies. She says that through her studies she wants to be able to help other people. That is why she puts forth a great deal of effort in order to be someone in life and to be a recognized professional.

She was able to pay for her classes with the previous loan. This was a big help in her studies. She is asking for this new loan to be able to make the payments for her career studies. This way she will continue struggling for her goals.

loans.use: to make university payments.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de Itá, es una persona que lucha y se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida, está estudiando la carrera de psicología, y comenta que sus metas son la de terminar su carrera y especializarse algún día.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder continuar con sus estudios como lo esta haciendo.
texts.en:
Liz is from the city of Itá. She is a person who struggles and puts forth great effort in order to be able to be someone in life.

She is studying for a career in psychology. She says that her goals are to finish her degree and to someday specialize.

She is requesting this loan to be able to make her career studies payments. This way she will be able to continue with her studies as she is doing.

loans.use: to make her career studies payments.

loans.name: Maly

texts.en:
Being as a soy milk seller, Maly, who is 46 years old married woman, can only make USD 5 per day to support her family. Maly is living with four children in a community of Mukampoul District, Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this small business for nearly four years.

Maly would like to secure KIVA loan now in order to build a hygienic latrine in her house since she has never had it before. She is very happy with this loan since it will promote good health, environment and living standard in her house. Maly would like to thank all lenders for their generosity in providing such a great loan for poor people like her.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Senona

texts.en:
Senona works hard to support her family. Senona is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Senona requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, noodles, bread, spices, cooking oil, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

Senona has been in this business for 10 years now.

Senona would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, noodles, bread, spices, cooking oil, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Alzira

texts.en:
Alzira is a businesswoman and she has a small kiosk, so she is requesting a loan of USD 600 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk, such as noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, gambling cards, coffee, water, sugar, hand and body lotion, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

Alzira opened her kiosk in 2014 with her own working capital of USD 700. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin in order to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, gambling cards, coffee, water, sugar, hand and body lotion, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is well known farmer mainly dealing in coffee farming. He started this project in 2000 and he has managed to sustain his wife and four children. He has another side income cattle rearing where he earns incomes to support his family. John was born in 1956. His children are aged 22, 18, 16, and 12 years old respectively. All of them are in school.

He has applied for a loan of Ugx2,000,000 to buy fertilizers for manuring his coffee shamba to increase the yields and family sustainability. He is an honest man at work, in his business and he works for 8 hours a day. He sells to all coffee factories around Bushenyi District. He is faced with the challenge of pests and diseases that affect the harvest. His vision is to build a good and big house.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en: Nour is a 21 year old Lebanese single woman. She lives with her parents and her two siblings, one of them are still studying. Her father and brother are the main income source in the family to be able to enhance their way of living. As for her, she is only focusing on her study. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her Technical study fees. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva to continue her education, her only target.

loans.use: to pay her Technical study fees

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 44 years old and has one child. She helps her husband by working on their own farm to make a living. For five years they have grown coconut, and the couple earns well for them to provide for the family.

Recently, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to micro finance services and took a loan to purchase organic fertilizer. She wants to maintain and improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family. In the future, she wants to meet the educational needs of her child.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 62 years old and married with two children. Laura works very hard to provide for them.

Laura runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, juices, home product care, and other groceries.

Laura has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Laura would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, junk foods, juices, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Mussrat

texts.en:
Mussrat is 48 years old and married woman. She has been doing a business of bangles sales for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore she started her own business to contribute to the family income.

Mussrat has requested a loan of 40000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate an healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales to generate an healthier source of income

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 50 years old and married with three children. 

Angelita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Angelita has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is 62 years old, hardworking woman who has 4 children. She has been providing the service of sewing clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in stitching. Bushra’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Bushra has requested for a loan amount 45000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of threads and laces for meeting the demands of her customers consistently.

loans.name: Yami Group

texts.en:
Nelia is the featured borrower of Yami group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends, ever since they left their hometown in the Philippines. They came to work in Lebanon for a better income to support their beloved ones back in the Philippines.

Nelia is a 51-year-old married mother of one child. She works hard as a housekeeper to cover the expenses and needs of her beloved kids and improve their living conditions. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her child's school tuition fees in the Philippines. She is the first lady on the left of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Marife is the lady standing in the middle, and Mindaluna is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay her child's school tuition fees in the Philippines.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man who started selling linens almost a year ago to cover his needs and expenses. He gained experience in this domain from his parents. He is an ambitious man and hard worker who is trying to gain loyal customers.

Mohammad is still at the beginning of this business, he is putting much time and effort into developing his business. Thus today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with the new collection of linens to satisfy his customers' needs with diversified products.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with the new collection of linens to diversify his products.

loans.name: Analia

texts.es:
Analia es una persona muy sacrificada que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida. Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas.
Ella vive con sus padres, y espera llegar a ser una buena Profesional.Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Analia is a self-sacrificing individual who is giving her best effort to make something out of her life. She is studying for a degree in Business Administration.

Analia lives with her parents and hopes to become a successful professional. She is requesting this loan in order to pay her university fees, which will allow her to continue her studies just as before. Analia is grateful for the opportunity she has received so that she can keep studying.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is 26 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries.

Joana has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Rocky

texts.en: Rocky is 34 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. He has operated a transportation services business for six years, and he earns 10,000 PHP a month to support his family's needs. Rocky joined GDMPC and is now requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to buy vehicle spare parts and accessories for repair and maintenance. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy vehicle spare parts and accessories for repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha, 41, is a widowed mother with three children. She is from Takeo province in Cambodia. Sokha earns some income from working as a security guard, and she has been in this work for over nine years. Two of her children work as factory workers and the third one attends school. All of them can earn $16 per day.

Sokha would like to apply for loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. With this loan, she will have enough money to buy a motorcycle to improve her traveling conditions. In the future, she is going to build a proper house and support her youngest child to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha is 33 years old and has two children who are in school.

Editha has a food vending business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables, noodles, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Editha has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables, noodles, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Cristo Moreno Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Doris Felicitas ella es casada y tiene 66 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ferreteria,la socia vende clavos, pinturas y alambres, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora que por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a su hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferreteria.La socia solicita el crédito para comprar clavos, pinturas y alambres.
La socia que estan pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieo permiso por motivos de trabajo.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de venta de cosmeticos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Cristo Moreno." This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

One of the members is Señora Doris Felicitas. She is married and is 66 years old. She has five children. She works in her business of selling hardware. She sells nails, paints, and wires. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has already had this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her. She is a very hard-working woman who has raised her children through this work. Her dream is to expand her hardware business. She is applying for a loan in order to purchase nails, paints, and wires.

The member's photo that is attached to the group photo was taken after the meeting because she asked permission [to arrive late] for work reasons.

The other members work in businesses such as selling clothing, selling cosmetics, grocery store, and restaurant.

This member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy nails, paints, and wires.

loans.name: Jeryl

texts.en: Jeryl is a 36-year-old married woman. She settled in Looc, Libertad, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines to earn a living together with her five children. Over the past twelve years, Jeryl was able to establish a retail store that absolutely met the market's primary demands in their village. Until now, the business has done well and is providing better cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. Jeryl joined GDMPC  to have access to financial services. She is requesting new loan from GDMPC to buy more grocery goods to sell. Jeryl expects an increase in sales which will expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Emierita

texts.en:
Emierita is 34 years old and married with 2 children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Emierita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk food, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Emierita has been in this business for 3 years, and she sells a variety of items.

In the future, Emierita would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 38 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles, and other snack foods.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, bread, drinks, spices, noodles, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is 50 years old, and she is married with 3 children, 2 of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Isabel has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Isabel has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 34 years old and single.

Glenda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Glenda requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Glenda has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Glenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 35 year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Irshad runs a small boutique at home she sell garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews them and then sells at a high price in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothing is due to attractive designs and colors. Her husband covers all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.

She wants to increase the variety of clothing available on a daily basis, this is the reason she has requested a loan so that she can buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Irshad wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide better education to her children. Irshad is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Ermoda

texts.en:
Ermoda is a 48-year-old married woman with four children, who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a direct sales business, selling Avon products, in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products from Avon, like deodorant, lipsticks, lotion, body spray, etc., to sell.

Ermoda has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Avon, like deodorant, lipsticks, lotion, body spray, etc., to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 49 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like eggs, snack foods, home care products, condiments, and other groceries.

Dolores has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like eggs, snack foods, home care products, condiments, and other groceries

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto proviene de una familia trabajadora, que lucha día a día para alcanzar sus metas. Él está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería agrónoma, a través de la cual quiere poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. 
En corto tiempo se ve ejerciendo la profesión en alguna importante empresa. Con aspiración de triunfar y mejorar su vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Humberto comes from a working family that strives day to day to reach their goals. He is studying Agricultural Engineering, through which he wants to improve his living conditions.

In a short time he will be working in his profession in an important company with hopes of succeeding and improving his life.

He is requesting this loan to be able to cover the costs of his graduating and in this way pay for this expense.

loans.use: to pay graduating fees.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a resident in the town of Bilar, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells commodities like chips, sugar, biscuits, powdered milk, cooking oil and toiletries. She has operated a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 10 years now.
She is married woman with two children ages 15 and 17 year old respectively.

She has requested a loan to buy groceries inventory like noodles, condiments and beverages. Thus, the loan could help boost her income and enable her to maintain the inventory of her store.
With this inventory to sell, Fe could start to settle her finances and start to expand to improve her earnings more.

loans.use: to buy groceries like noodles, condiments and beverages to sell in her store

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines.

Cherry requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Cherry would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 36 years old and has three children. She is married and all three of her children are in school.

Annalyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables and corn in the Philippines. Annalyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Annalyn has been farming vegetables and corn for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Annalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat  is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting business of tailoring in her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Nusrat  is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested for a loan of PKR 45000. With the requested loan, she wants  to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to sew more dresses on time.  She hopes to achieve an increase in her income.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch up more dresses on time

loans.name: Arzygul

texts.ru: Арзыгуль, 31 год, замужем, есть дочь. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимаются животноводством и садоводством, стартовав 8 лет назад. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы. Благодаря упорному труду, Арзыгуль на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошую прибыль от бизнеса в среднем 26,000 сом в месяц (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Арзыгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Арзыгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Arzygul is 31 years old, married, and has a daughter. She has a secondary education.  Eight years ago she and her husband started practicing animal husbandry and farming to earn income for the family. They currently own two cows. Thanks to her perseverance Arzygul now earns a good profit - 26,000 som (KGS) per month on average. In order to further develop her business Arzygul is asking Bai Tushum Bank for a 100,000 som (KGS) loan to buy three cows to grow her herd. She plans to invest proceeds from use of the loan into further business development.

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia está estudiando la carrera de psicología, es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, comenta que a la par que estudia también está trabajando para poder cubrir los gastos que tiene.
Ella es una persona muy sacrificada que poco a poco está luchando para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de sus útiles, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Alicia, who is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, is studying in order to pursue a career in psychology. Alicia reports that at the same time that she is studying, she is also working in order to be able to help cover those expenses.

Alicia is a very sacrificing person who, little by little, is struggling to be able to improve her conditions of life as well as those of her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan so that she can cover her university expenses, in order to continue her studies.

loans.use: pay her university fees.

loans.name: Lynne

texts.en:
Lynne is a hardworking entrepreneur. She has a beauty parlor in the Philippines and has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy new supplies for her beauty parlor.

Lynne has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business.

Lynne dreams that, one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her beauty parlor.

loans.name: Bazargul

texts.ru: Базаргул успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На данный момент в хозяйстве Базаргул имеется 4 коровы, 10 овец. На 0,60 Га земли она выращивает хлопок для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Базаргул вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Базаргул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и образование ее внуков.
texts.en: Bazargul successfully repaid her previous loan after using the funds as planned. She is grateful to Kiva and all who helped with the financing. Currently Bazargul owns four cows and ten sheep, and grows cotton on 0.60 hectares of land. In order to further develop her business Bazargul came to Bai Tushum Bank once more for a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) to buy ten sheep to expand her herd. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further expanding her livestock herd and contributing to her grandchildren's education.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep in order to expand her livestock herd.

loans.name: Nurafshon

texts.ru: Серьезный, честный, молодой парень из района Файзабад, Нурафшон. Ему всего 22 года. Он единственный сын в семье. Нурафшон живет вместе отцом и матерью. Он после окончания школы решил идти по стопам отца, и сохранить его деятельность. Сейчас Нурафшон во дворе выращивает мелко рогатого скота. Уже три года он занимается животноводством. Животноводческая деятельность является основной источником дохода. Нурафшон хочет увеличить поголовья скота и сохранить деятельность. По причине, что у него осталось малое количества скотов. За счет кредита он купить мелко рогатого скота. Нурафшон ждет  поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en: Nurafshon is a serious and honest young man from the Fayzabad district. He is 22 years old, and his family's only son. Nurafshon lives with his mother and father. After high school he decided to follow in his father's footsteps and continue his business. For the past three years he has been raising small livestock on the land around his home. This work provides his primary source of income. Nurafshon currently has few animals, but wants to expand his herd and keep the business going. He will use the loan to buy small livestock. He hopes for support from your side.

loans.use: increase his livestock herd and maintain his business

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Zaida estudia para poder ser una técnico en enfermería, es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Ella estudia para tener una mejor calidad de vida y tiene aspiraciones de trabajar y seguir estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Zaida is studying to be a nursing technician. She is a very self-sacrificing person who wants to improve her living conditions.

She is studying so that she can have a better quality of life, and she has aspirations of working and continuing to study.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay her college tuition and continue studying as she currently does.

loans.use: to pay college fees

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Kyrey está en su ciclo número 29° del programa de comité de mujeres, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una de las integrantes se esfuerza para poder mejorar sus vidas y que no tengan que pasar por privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de productos farmacéuticos que hace se viene ganando la vida para poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones, ella es una persona muy sacrificada que poco a poco se ha podido ganar una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella.
La Sra. Maria  solicita este prestamo para la compra de productos farmacéuticos para su posterior venta, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Kuña Kyrey group is in its 29th cycle of the Women's Committee program. The women are in the poverty elimination program, in which each of the members strives to be able to improve her life and not go through hardships like she has in the past. 

One of the members is Maria, who through effort and continuous work and through the sale of pharmaceutical products is making a living in order to give her family a dignified life without deprivation. She is a very devoted person who, little by little, has been able to acquire a reliable clientele who always buys from her. 

Maria is asking for this loan in order to purchase pharmaceutical products to sell, which will help her finalize her business plan, and in turn will help improve her income.

loans.use: to purchase pharmaceutical products to sell.

loans.name: Arzikul

texts.ru: Арзикул проживает в районе Шахритуз. Уже три года как занимается животноводством. Образование высшее.  Он женат,  имеет четверо детей.  В свои 57 лет Арзикул добился многого.  Теперь он хочет закупить нескольких телят и тем самым увеличит свой доход.  Но для этого ему нужна дополнительная сумма. Человек он очень трудолюбивый. Арзикул унаследовал это дело от своего отца. Вся его семья трудится во благо процветания семейного  бизнеса.  Его цель достичь хороших результатов. Арзикул очень надеется на Вашу поддержку, и в дальнейшем надеется сотрудничать.
texts.en: Arzikul lives in the Shahrituz district. It has already been three years since he began raising livestock. Arzikul has a college education, is married, and has four children. He has achieved a lot in his 57 years. Now he wants to buy a few calves to increase his income, but it will require additional capital. He is a very hardworking man who learned the trade from his father. His goal is what all of his family members work toward: making the business successful. Arzikul very much hopes for your support, and to work together in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a few calves.

loans.name: Stilber

texts.es:
Stilber es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, es de la ciudad de Encarnación, trabaja en servicios de decoraciones, alquileres en general y sillas, mesas y otros.
Además tiene un vivero y distribuye gas en la zona, como se puede notar el Sr. Stilber se esfuerza para poder crecer y ayudar a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sillas y mesas para poder seguir dando un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Stilber is a very hardworking and enterprising person. He is from the city of Encarnación and works in decorations services and general rentals, including chairs and tables, among other products. 

He also has a plant nursery and distributes gas in his neighborhood. As you can tell, Stilber strives to be able to progress and to help his family. He is asking for this loan in order to be able to purchase chairs and tables so that he can continue offering good service.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and tables.

loans.name: Toshjamol

texts.ru: Тошжамол успешно погасила свой предыдущий кредит и купила несколько голов телят. Она откармливала их и продала с наценкой. Тошжамол получила хорошую прибыль и улучшила жизненные условия своей семьи. Тошжамол очень благодарна Вам за поддержку и доброту.  Теперь она дополнительно занимается   растениеводством. Выращивает разные виды овощей и поставляет их на рынок.  Этим она обеспечивает свою семью. В этой деятельности ей помогает ее семья. На сей раз Тошжамол обратилась за кредитом, чтобы посадить зерна лука и купить разные семена овощей.  В будущем она намерена открыть большой овощной магазин в своем районе.  Тошжамол обратилась за помощью к Вам.  Она и на этот раз надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Toshjamol successfully paid back her previous loan and bought several calves. She raised and sold the calves for a good profit, which allowed her to improve her family's living conditions. Toshjamol is grateful for your support and kindness.

Now she is also raising a variety of vegetables to sell at the market. She supports her family with this, and they help her with the work. This time Toshjamol is asking for a loan for planting onions and buying various vegetable seeds. In the future she intends to open a large produce store in her area. Toshjamol is coming to you for help. She hopes for your support once again.

loans.use: to plant onions and buy a variety of vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Sireen

texts.en:
Sireen is a 26-year-old married mother from Dier Al-Balah. Her husband works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all of the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Sireen's husband took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar power system for heating water for his family's house. By taking this loan, he will be able to decrease electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).

Sireen’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.

Sireen appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system for heating water for her family's house.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nelia is 55 years old and has one child still in school.

Nelia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like a fish net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Nelia has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like a fish net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
As a parent of 3 children, Nerissa works hard to support her family.

Nerissa has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish. She is borrowing 5,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more vegetables to resell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Nerissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is 44 years old and a mother of four dependent children living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she needs to support three children and one of them is in school. She grows cassava and weaves cotton scarves to earn income for her family’s living. Moreover, she can get extra income via working as a labor worker. She has been involved in this business for 24 years and she can save with her income about $6 USD per day.

This is her second microloan with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan completely. The previous loan has helped her business grow and she can earn more income to support her children’s studying better. In the group of four, she is the group leader.

She will use her loan portion to buy cotton thread to support her weaving business and take the remaining money to pay for plowing fees for her cassava farm. She hopes that her business runs smoother than before and earns her a decent income for her family’s living in the future.

loans.use: to buy cotton thread to support her weaving business to run smoother and earn her a decent income to save for future need.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn is a 33-year-old married factory worker with two children in her care; she lives in a village in the Takeo province in Cambodia.

She has worked in a factory since 2005. Her husband is a 38-year-old taxi driver, and her two children attend school. Both Sophorn and her husband make $10 USD per day. She will use a loan through KREDIT MFI to buy piglets to raise and sell. With this loan, she will improve her family’s finances.

In the future, Sophorn is going to expand her business, save money to renovate a house, and support her two children's education.

loans.use: to buy piglets to fatten to sell

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader is a 32-year-old, married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Nader took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Nader will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Nader’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes. Nader appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina has owned and managed her farm for six years, earns a good profit, and successfully repaid her previous loan. She uses the funds to Improve her coco farm.

She will use a new loan to purchase fertilizer. Antonina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Milagros  es un grupo nuevo, está en su ciclo 1, es un grupo nuevo donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y ser alguien en la vida. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Veronica se dedica a la venta de comidas, ella misma las hace desde muy tempranas horas del día y después sale a venderlos de manera ambulante por su barrio. Comenta que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como carne, condimentos, hortalizas, panificados y otros, de manera a poder deleitando a sus clientes con las comidas que hace.
texts.en:
The Milagros [Miracles] group is a new group in its first cycle. It's a new group in which all the women are putting their best effort into being able to progress and to be someone in life. They are in the poverty elimination program, fighting to be able to grow and improve. 

One of the members is Veronica who sells food. She makes the food herself in the early hours of the day and then goes out to sell it in the streets of her neighborhood. 

She says that she is asking for this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of supplies for her food, such as meat, condiments, vegetables, baked goods, and more, so that she can delight her customers with the meals she prepares.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as meats, condiments, vegetables, baked goods, and more, in order to prepare meals.
